pli-tv-kd2:0.3.eng: The chapter on the observance day

pli-tv-kd2:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā rājagahe viharati gijjhakūṭe pabbate.
pli-tv-kd2:1.1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying on the Vulture Peak at Rājagaha.

pli-tv-kd2:1.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatitthiyā paribbājakā cātuddase pannarase aṭṭhamiyā ca pakkhassa sannipatitvā dhammaṃ bhāsanti.
pli-tv-kd2:1.1.2.eng: At that time, on the fourteenth, fifteenth, and eighth day of the lunar half-month, the wanderers of other religions gathered and gave teachings.

pli-tv-kd2:1.1.3.eng: People went to listen to those teachings,

pli-tv-kd2:1.1.4.pli: Te labhanti aññatitthiyesu paribbājakesu pemaṃ, labhanti pasādaṃ, labhanti aññatitthiyā paribbājakā pakkhaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:1.1.4.eng: and they acquired affection for and confidence in those wanderers. And the wanderers gained supporters.

pli-tv-kd2:1.2.1.pli: Atha kho rañño māgadhassa seniyassa bimbisārassa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi—
pli-tv-kd2:1.2.1.eng: Then, when King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha was reflecting in private,

pli-tv-kd2:1.2.2.pli: “etarahi kho aññatitthiyā paribbājakā cātuddase pannarase aṭṭhamiyā ca pakkhassa sannipatitvā dhammaṃ bhāsanti.

pli-tv-kd2:1.2.4.pli: Te labhanti aññatitthiyesu paribbājakesu pemaṃ, labhanti pasādaṃ, labhanti aññatitthiyā paribbājakā pakkhaṃ.

pli-tv-kd2:1.2.5.pli: Yannūna ayyāpi cātuddase pannarase aṭṭhamiyā ca pakkhassa sannipateyyun”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:1.2.5.eng: and thought, “Why don’t the venerables, too, gather on the fourteenth, fifteenth, and eighth day of the half-month?”

pli-tv-kd2:1.3.1.pli: Atha kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd2:1.3.1.eng: He then went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd2:1.3.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd2:1.3.2.eng: and told him what he had thought,

pli-tv-kd2:1.3.3.pli: “idha mayhaṃ, bhante, rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi ‘etarahi kho aññatitthiyā paribbājakā cātuddase pannarase aṭṭhamiyā ca pakkhassa sannipatitvā dhammaṃ bhāsanti.

pli-tv-kd2:1.3.5.pli: Te labhanti aññatitthiyesu paribbājakesu pemaṃ, labhanti pasādaṃ, labhanti aññatitthiyā paribbājakā pakkhaṃ.

pli-tv-kd2:1.3.6.pli: Yannūna ayyāpi cātuddase pannarase aṭṭhamiyā ca pakkhassa sannipateyyun’ti.

pli-tv-kd2:1.3.7.pli: Sādhu, bhante, ayyāpi cātuddase pannarase aṭṭhamiyā ca pakkhassa sannipateyyun”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:1.3.7.eng: adding, “It would be good, sir, if the venerables, too, gathered on the fourteenth, fifteenth, and eighth day of the half-month.”

pli-tv-kd2:1.4.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā rājānaṃ māgadhaṃ seniyaṃ bimbisāraṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṃsesi.
pli-tv-kd2:1.4.1.eng: The Buddha then instructed, inspired, and gladdened him with a teaching.

pli-tv-kd2:1.4.2.pli: Atha kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassito samādapito samuttejito sampahaṃsito uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd2:1.4.2.eng: When the Buddha had finished, the king got up from his seat, bowed, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and left.

pli-tv-kd2:1.4.3.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd2:1.4.3.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd2:1.4.4.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, cātuddase pannarase aṭṭhamiyā ca pakkhassa sannipatitun”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:1.4.4.eng: “You should gather together on the fourteenth, the fifteenth, and the eighth day of the lunar half-month.”

pli-tv-kd2:2.1.2.pli: “bhagavatā anuññātā cātuddase pannarase aṭṭhamiyā ca pakkhassa sannipatitun”ti—

pli-tv-kd2:2.1.3.pli: cātuddase pannarase aṭṭhamiyā ca pakkhassa sannipatitvā tuṇhī nisīdanti.
pli-tv-kd2:2.1.3.eng: they started gathering on those days.

pli-tv-kd2:2.1.4.eng: People came to hear a teaching, but the monks sat in silence.

pli-tv-kd2:2.1.5.eng: The people complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd2:2.1.6.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā cātuddase pannarase aṭṭhamiyā ca pakkhassa sannipatitvā tuṇhī nisīdissanti, seyyathāpi mūgasūkarā.
pli-tv-kd2:2.1.6.eng: “How can the Sakyan monastics gather on the fourteenth, fifteenth, and eighth day of the half-month, but then sit in silence like dumb pigs?

pli-tv-kd2:2.1.7.eng: Shouldn’t they give a teaching when they gather together?”

pli-tv-kd2:2.1.8.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:2.1.8.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people

pli-tv-kd2:2.1.9.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…

pli-tv-kd2:2.1.10.pli: atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd2:2.1.10.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd2:2.1.11.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, cātuddase pannarase aṭṭhamiyā ca pakkhassa sannipatitvā dhammaṃ bhāsitun”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:2.1.11.eng: “When you gather together on the fourteenth, the fifteenth, and the eighth day of the lunar half-month, you should give a teaching.”

pli-tv-kd2:3.1.0.eng: 2. The instruction to recite the Monastic Code

pli-tv-kd2:3.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavato rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi—
pli-tv-kd2:3.1.1.eng: While the Buddha was reflecting in private, he thought,

pli-tv-kd2:3.1.2.pli: “yannūnāhaṃ yāni mayā bhikkhūnaṃ paññattāni sikkhāpadāni, tāni nesaṃ pātimokkhuddesaṃ anujāneyyaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:3.1.2.eng: “Why don’t I instruct the monks to recite a monastic code, consisting of those training rules that I have laid down for them?

pli-tv-kd2:3.1.3.eng: That would be their procedure for the observance day.”

pli-tv-kd2:3.2.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā sāyanhasamayaṃ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd2:3.2.1.eng: In the evening, when the Buddha had come out from seclusion, he gave a teaching and addressed the monks.

pli-tv-kd2:3.2.2.pli: “idha mayhaṃ, bhikkhave, rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi ‘yannūnāhaṃ yāni mayā bhikkhūnaṃ paññattāni sikkhāpadāni, tāni nesaṃ pātimokkhuddesaṃ anujāneyyaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:3.2.2.eng: He told them what he had thought, adding:

pli-tv-kd2:3.3.1.eng: And you should do it like this.

pli-tv-kd2:3.3.2.eng: A competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd2:3.3.3.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd2:3.3.4.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho uposathaṃ kareyya, pātimokkhaṃ uddiseyya.
pli-tv-kd2:3.3.4.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should do the observance-day ceremony, it should recite the Monastic Code.
pli-tv-kd2:3.3.4.comm: “Observance-day ceremony” renders uposatha. See Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd2:3.3.5.eng: What is the preliminary duty of the Sangha?

pli-tv-kd2:3.3.6.eng: The venerables should declare their purity.

pli-tv-kd2:3.3.7.eng: I will recite the Monastic Code.

pli-tv-kd2:3.3.8.pli: Taṃ sabbeva santā sādhukaṃ suṇoma manasi karoma.
pli-tv-kd2:3.3.8.eng: Everyone present should listen to it and attend carefully.

pli-tv-kd2:3.3.9.eng: Anyone who has committed an offense should reveal it.

pli-tv-kd2:3.3.10.eng: If you haven’t committed any offense, you should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd2:3.3.11.eng: If you are silent, I will regard you as pure.

pli-tv-kd2:3.3.12.pli: Yathā kho pana paccekapuṭṭhassa veyyākaraṇaṃ hoti, evamevaṃ evarūpāya parisāya yāvatatiyaṃ anussāvitaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd2:3.3.12.eng: Just as one responds when asked individually, so too, an announcement is made three times in this kind of gathering.

pli-tv-kd2:3.3.13.pli: Yo pana bhikkhu yāvatatiyaṃ anussāviyamāne saramāno santiṃ āpattiṃ nāvikareyya, sampajānamusāvādassa hoti.
pli-tv-kd2:3.3.13.eng: If a monk remembers an offense while the announcement is being made up to the third time, but doesn’t reveal it, he is lying in full awareness.

pli-tv-kd2:3.3.14.pli: Sampajānamusāvādo kho panāyasmanto antarāyiko dhammo vutto bhagavatā.
pli-tv-kd2:3.3.14.eng: Lying in full awareness is called an obstacle by the Buddha.

pli-tv-kd2:3.3.15.pli: Tasmā, saramānena bhikkhunā āpannena visuddhāpekkhena santī āpatti āvikātabbā;
pli-tv-kd2:3.3.15.eng: A monk who remembers an offense and is seeking purification should therefore reveal it.

pli-tv-kd2:3.3.16.eng: When it’s revealed, he will be at ease.’”

pli-tv-kd2:3.4.2.pli: ādimetaṃ mukhametaṃ pamukhametaṃ kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ. Tena vuccati pātimokkhanti.
pli-tv-kd2:3.4.2.eng: this is the beginning, this is the front, this is at the head of wholesome qualities—therefore it is called “Monastic Code”.

pli-tv-kd2:3.4.4.eng: this is a term of affection, a term of respect; it is an expression of respect and deference, that is, “venerables”.

pli-tv-kd2:3.4.6.pli: ācikkhissāmi desessāmi paññapessāmi paṭṭhapessāmi vivarissāmi vibhajissāmi uttāniṃ karissāmi pakāsessāmi.
pli-tv-kd2:3.4.6.eng: I will set forth, I will teach, I will declare, I will set out, I will reveal, I will analyze, I will make plain, I will manifest.

pli-tv-kd2:3.4.8.eng: The Monastic Code is what is meant.

pli-tv-kd2:3.4.10.pli: yāvatikā tassā parisāya therā ca navā ca majjhimā ca, ete vuccanti sabbeva santāti.
pli-tv-kd2:3.4.10.eng: to whatever extent there are senior monks, junior monks, and monks of middle standing in that gathering—these are called “everyone present”.

pli-tv-kd2:3.4.12.pli: aṭṭhiṃ katvā manasi katvā sabbacetasā samannāharāma.
pli-tv-kd2:3.4.12.eng: should be attentive, should pay attention, should apply their whole mind.

pli-tv-kd2:3.4.14.eng: should listen with a one-pointed mind, with an undistracted mind, with a non-wandering mind.

pli-tv-kd2:3.5.1.eng: Anyone who has committed an offense:

pli-tv-kd2:3.5.2.pli: therassa vā navassa vā majjhimassa vā, pañcannaṃ vā āpattikkhandhānaṃ aññatarā āpatti, sattannaṃ vā āpattikkhandhānaṃ aññatarā āpatti.
pli-tv-kd2:3.5.2.eng: a senior monk, a junior monk, or a monk of middle standing who has committed a particular offense among the five or seven classes of offenses.

pli-tv-kd2:3.5.4.pli: so deseyya, so vivareyya, so uttāniṃ kareyya, so pakāseyya saṅghamajjhe vā gaṇamajjhe vā ekapuggale vā.
pli-tv-kd2:3.5.4.eng: should confess it, should disclose it, should make it plain, should make it known—either in the midst of the Sangha, in the midst of a group, or to an individual.

pli-tv-kd2:3.5.5.eng: If you haven’t committed any offense:

pli-tv-kd2:3.5.6.pli: anajjhāpannā vā hoti, āpajjitvā vā vuṭṭhitā.
pli-tv-kd2:3.5.6.eng: if you have not committed any offense or you have cleared yourself after committing one.

pli-tv-kd2:3.5.8.eng: you should be patient; you shouldn’t say anything.

pli-tv-kd2:3.5.9.eng: I will regard you as pure:

pli-tv-kd2:3.5.10.eng: I will know; I will remember.

pli-tv-kd2:3.6.1.pli: Yathā kho pana paccekapuṭṭhassa veyyākaraṇaṃ hotīti
pli-tv-kd2:3.6.1.eng: Just as one responds when asked individually:

pli-tv-kd2:3.6.2.pli: yathā ekena eko puṭṭho byākareyya, evameva tassā parisāya jānitabbaṃ maṃ pucchatīti.
pli-tv-kd2:3.6.2.eng: just as one would respond when asked privately, so too, one should know of that gathering, “It’s asking me.”

pli-tv-kd2:3.6.4.eng: a gathering of monks is what is meant.

pli-tv-kd2:3.6.5.eng: When the announcement is made three times:

pli-tv-kd2:3.6.6.pli: sakimpi anussāvitaṃ hoti, dutiyampi anussāvitaṃ hoti, tatiyampi anussāvitaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd2:3.6.6.eng: when the announcement is made once, when the announcement is made for the second time, and also when the announcement is made for the third time.

pli-tv-kd2:3.6.10.pli: ajjhāpannā vā hoti, āpajjitvā vā avuṭṭhitā.
pli-tv-kd2:3.6.10.eng: one that has been committed, or one that has not been cleared after being committed.
pli-tv-kd2:3.6.10.comm: The phrasing here is a bit curious, but according to the commentary at Sp 3.135 it is to be understood as the opposite of segment Kd 2:3.5.6 above.

pli-tv-kd2:3.6.12.pli: na deseyya, na vivareyya, na uttāniṃ kareyya, na pakāseyya saṅghamajjhe vā gaṇamajjhe vā ekapuggale vā.
pli-tv-kd2:3.6.12.eng: does not confess it, disclose it, make it plain, make it known—either in the midst of the Sangha, in the midst of a group, or to an individual.

pli-tv-kd2:3.7.1.eng: He is lying in full awareness:

pli-tv-kd2:3.7.2.eng: what is there for lying in full awareness?

pli-tv-kd2:3.7.3.eng: There is an act of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-kd2:3.7.3.comm: Sp 3.135: Dukkaṭaṁ hotīti dukkaṭāpatti hoti; sā ca kho na musāvādalakkhaṇena; bhagavato pana vacanena vacīdvāre akiriyasamuṭṭhānā āpatti hotīti veditabbā, “‘There is an act of wrong conduct’: there is an offense of wrong conduct. It does not have the characteristics of lying. But according to the statement by the Buddha, it is to be understood that there is an offense originating through non-action at the speech door.”

pli-tv-kd2:3.7.4.eng: Is called an obstacle by the Buddha:

pli-tv-kd2:3.7.6.pli: Paṭhamassa jhānassa adhigamāya antarāyiko, dutiyassa jhānassa adhigamāya antarāyiko, tatiyassa jhānassa adhigamāya antarāyiko, catutthassa jhānassa adhigamāya antarāyiko, jhānānaṃ vimokkhānaṃ samādhīnaṃ samāpattīnaṃ nekkhammānaṃ nissaraṇānaṃ pavivekānaṃ kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ adhigamāya antarāyiko.
pli-tv-kd2:3.7.6.eng: It is an obstacle for reaching the first absorption, the second absorption, the third absorption, the fourth absorption; an obstacle for reaching the wholesome qualities of absorption, release, stillness, attainment, renunciation, escape, seclusion.

pli-tv-kd2:3.7.12.eng: is desiring to be cleared, is desiring purity.

pli-tv-kd2:3.8.2.pli: ajjhāpannā vā hoti, āpajjitvā vā avuṭṭhitā.
pli-tv-kd2:3.8.2.eng: one that has been committed, or one that has not been cleared after being committed.

pli-tv-kd2:3.8.4.pli: āvikātabbā saṅghamajjhe vā gaṇamajjhe vā ekapuggale vā.
pli-tv-kd2:3.8.4.eng: should reveal it either in the midst of the Sangha, in the midst of a group, or to an individual.

pli-tv-kd2:3.8.5.eng: When it’s revealed, he will be at ease:

pli-tv-kd2:3.8.7.pli: Paṭhamassa jhānassa adhigamāya phāsu hoti, dutiyassa jhānassa adhigamāya phāsu hoti, tatiyassa jhānassa adhigamāya phāsu hoti, catutthassa jhānassa adhigamāya phāsu hoti, jhānānaṃ vimokkhānaṃ samādhīnaṃ samāpattīnaṃ nekkhammānaṃ nissaraṇānaṃ pavivekānaṃ kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ adhigamāya phāsu hotīti.
pli-tv-kd2:3.8.7.eng: He will be at ease for reaching the first absorption, the second absorption, the third absorption, the forth absorption; at ease for reaching the wholesome qualities of absorption, release, stillness, attainment, renunciation, escape, seclusion.

pli-tv-kd2:4.1.2.eng: that the Buddha required the recitation of the Monastic Code,

pli-tv-kd2:4.1.5.eng: “You shouldn’t recite the Monastic Code every day.

pli-tv-kd2:4.1.6.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:4.1.7.eng: You should recite the Monastic Code on the observance day.”

pli-tv-kd2:4.2.2.eng: that the Buddha required the recitation of the Monastic Code on the observance day,

pli-tv-kd2:4.2.3.pli: pakkhassa tikkhattuṃ pātimokkhaṃ uddisanti, cātuddase pannarase aṭṭhamiyā ca pakkhassa.
pli-tv-kd2:4.2.3.eng: some monks recited it three times per half-month: on the fourteenth, fifteenth, and eighth day.

pli-tv-kd2:4.2.5.eng: “You shouldn’t recite the Monastic Code three times per lunar half-month.

pli-tv-kd2:4.2.6.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:4.2.7.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, sakiṃ pakkhassa cātuddase vā pannarase vā pātimokkhaṃ uddisitun”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:4.2.7.eng: You should recite the Monastic Code once every lunar half-month: on the fourteenth or the fifteenth day.”

pli-tv-kd2:5.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū yathāparisāya pātimokkhaṃ uddisanti sakāya sakāya parisāya.
pli-tv-kd2:5.1.1.eng: On one occasion the monks from the group of six recited the Monastic Code separately, each to his own followers.

pli-tv-kd2:5.1.3.pli: “Na, bhikkhave, yathāparisāya pātimokkhaṃ uddisitabbaṃ sakāya sakāya parisāya.
pli-tv-kd2:5.1.3.eng: “You shouldn’t recite the Monastic Code separately, each to your own followers.

pli-tv-kd2:5.1.4.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:5.1.5.eng: You should do the observance-day procedure in a complete assembly.”

pli-tv-kd2:5.2.2.eng: that the Buddha had laid down a rule

pli-tv-kd2:5.2.3.eng: that the observance-day procedure should be done in a complete assembly,

pli-tv-kd2:5.2.4.pli: Kittāvatā nu kho sāmaggī hoti, yāvatā ekāvāso, udāhu sabbā pathavī”ti?
pli-tv-kd2:5.2.4.eng: the monks thought, “How far does a complete assembly extend? As far as one monastery or as far as the entire earth?”

pli-tv-kd2:5.2.6.eng: “A complete assembly extends as far as one monastery.”

pli-tv-kd2:5.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā mahākappino rājagahe viharati maddakucchimhi migadāye.
pli-tv-kd2:5.3.1.eng: At that time Venerable Mahākappina was staying at Rājagaha in the deer park at Maddakucchi.

pli-tv-kd2:5.3.2.pli: Atha kho āyasmato mahākappinassa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi—
pli-tv-kd2:5.3.2.eng: On one occasion, while reflecting in private, he thought,

pli-tv-kd2:5.3.3.pli: “gaccheyyaṃ vāhaṃ uposathaṃ na vā gaccheyyaṃ, gaccheyyaṃ vāhaṃ saṅghakammaṃ na vā gaccheyyaṃ, atha khvāhaṃ visuddho paramāya visuddhiyā”ti?
pli-tv-kd2:5.3.3.eng: “Should I go to the observance-day ceremony? Should I go to the legal procedures of the Sangha? Regardless, I’ve reached the highest purity.”

pli-tv-kd2:5.4.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmato mahākappinassa cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya—

pli-tv-kd2:5.4.2.pli: seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso samiñjitaṃ vā bāhaṃ pasāreyya, pasāritaṃ vā bāhaṃ samiñjeyya; evameva—gijjhakūṭe pabbate antarahito maddakucchimhi migadāye āyasmato mahākappinassa sammukhe pāturahosi.
pli-tv-kd2:5.4.2.eng: Then, just as a strong man might bend or stretch his arm, the Buddha disappeared from the Vulture Peak and reappeared in front of Mahākappina,

pli-tv-kd2:5.4.3.eng: where he sat down on the prepared seat.

pli-tv-kd2:5.4.4.pli: Āyasmāpi kho mahākappino bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.

pli-tv-kd2:5.5.1.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho āyasmantaṃ mahākappinaṃ bhagavā etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd2:5.5.1.eng: and the Buddha said to him:

pli-tv-kd2:5.5.2.pli: “nanu te, kappina, rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi—

pli-tv-kd2:5.5.3.pli: gaccheyyaṃ vāhaṃ uposathaṃ na vā gaccheyyaṃ, gaccheyyaṃ vāhaṃ saṅghakammaṃ na vā gaccheyyaṃ, atha khvāhaṃ visuddho paramāya visuddhiyā”ti?
pli-tv-kd2:5.5.3.eng: that you were wondering whether or not you should go to the observance day and the legal procedures of the Sangha?”

pli-tv-kd2:5.5.5.pli: “Tumhe ce brāhmaṇā uposathaṃ na sakkarissatha na garukarissatha na mānessatha na pūjessatha, atha ko carahi uposathaṃ sakkarissati garukarissati mānessati pūjessati?
pli-tv-kd2:5.5.5.eng: “If you brahmins don’t honor and revere the observance day, then who will?

pli-tv-kd2:5.5.6.pli: Gaccha tvaṃ, brāhmaṇa, uposathaṃ, mā no agamāsi.
pli-tv-kd2:5.5.6.eng: Go to the observance day, brahmin,

pli-tv-kd2:5.5.7.pli: Gaccha tvaṃ saṅghakammaṃ, mā no agamāsī”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:5.5.7.eng: and go to the legal procedures of the Sangha.”

pli-tv-kd2:5.5.8.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā mahākappino bhagavato paccassosi.

pli-tv-kd2:5.6.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ mahākappinaṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṃsetvā—
pli-tv-kd2:5.6.1.eng: The Buddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened him with a teaching.

pli-tv-kd2:5.6.2.pli: seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso samiñjitaṃ vā bāhaṃ pasāreyya, pasāritaṃ vā bāhaṃ samiñjeyya; evameva—maddakucchimhi migadāye āyasmato mahākappinassa sammukhe antarahito gijjhakūṭe pabbate pāturahosi.
pli-tv-kd2:5.6.2.eng: Then, just as a strong man might bend or stretch his arm, the Buddha disappeared from Mahākappina’s presence and reappeared on the Vulture Peak.

pli-tv-kd2:6.1.2.eng: that the Buddha had laid down a rule

pli-tv-kd2:6.1.3.pli: ‘ettāvatā sāmaggī yāvatā ekāvāso’ti, kittāvatā nu kho ekāvāso hotī”ti?
pli-tv-kd2:6.1.3.eng: that a complete assembly extends as far as one monastery, the monks thought, “How far does a single monastery extend?”

pli-tv-kd2:6.1.5.eng: “I allow you to establish a monastery zone.
pli-tv-kd2:6.1.5.comm: “Monastery zone” renders sīmā. See Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd2:6.1.6.eng: And it should be established like this.

pli-tv-kd2:6.1.7.eng: First you should announce the zone markers:

pli-tv-kd2:6.1.8.pli: pabbatanimittaṃ, pāsāṇanimittaṃ, vananimittaṃ, rukkhanimittaṃ, magganimittaṃ, vammikanimittaṃ, nadīnimittaṃ, udakanimittaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:6.1.8.eng: a hill, a rock, a forest grove, a tree, a path, an anthill, a river, a lake.

pli-tv-kd2:6.1.9.pli: Nimitte kittetvā byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
pli-tv-kd2:6.1.9.eng: Then a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd2:6.1.10.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd2:6.1.12.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho etehi nimittehi sīmaṃ sammanneyya samānasaṃvāsaṃ ekuposathaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:6.1.12.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should establish a monastery zone based on the announced markers, defining who belongs to the same community and who should do the observance-day ceremony together.
pli-tv-kd2:6.1.12.comm: Nānāsaṁvāsa (and samānasaṁvāsa) need to be carefully distinguished from nānāsaṁvāsaka (and samānasaṁvāsaka). The former means “belonging to a different community”, as decided by sīmās. The latter means “one belonging to a different Buddhist sect”.

pli-tv-kd2:6.2.1.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd2:6.2.3.pli: Saṅgho etehi nimittehi sīmaṃ sammannati samānasaṃvāsaṃ ekuposathaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:6.2.3.eng: The Sangha establishes a monastery zone based on the announced markers, defining who belongs to the same community and who should do the observance-day ceremony together.

pli-tv-kd2:6.2.4.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati etehi nimittehi sīmāya sammuti samānasaṃvāsāya ekuposathāya, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd2:6.2.4.eng: Any monk who approves of establishing a monastery zone based on these markers, defining who belongs to the same community and who should do the observance-day ceremony together, should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd2:6.2.5.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd2:6.2.6.pli: Sammatā sīmā saṅghena etehi nimittehi samānasaṃvāsā ekuposathā.
pli-tv-kd2:6.2.6.eng: The Sangha has established a monastery zone based on these markers, defining who belongs to the same community and who should do the observance-day ceremony together.

pli-tv-kd2:6.2.7.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:6.2.7.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-kd2:7.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū—

pli-tv-kd2:7.1.2.eng: that the Buddha had made an allowance to establish a monastery zone,

pli-tv-kd2:7.1.3.pli: atimahatiyo sīmāyo sammannanti, catuyojanikāpi pañcayojanikāpi chayojanikāpi.
pli-tv-kd2:7.1.3.eng: the monks from the group of six established zones that were too large: 50, 65, and even 80 kilometers across.

pli-tv-kd2:7.1.4.pli: Bhikkhū uposathaṃ āgacchantā uddissamānepi pātimokkhe āgacchanti, uddiṭṭhamattepi āgacchanti, antarāpi parivasanti.
pli-tv-kd2:7.1.4.eng: Monks coming to the observance-day ceremony arrived while the Monastic Code was being recited or just after, and they had to stop overnight while on the way.

pli-tv-kd2:7.1.6.pli: “Na, bhikkhave, atimahatī sīmā sammannitabbā, catuyojanikā vā pañcayojanikā vā chayojanikā vā.
pli-tv-kd2:7.1.6.eng: “You shouldn’t establish a monastery zone that is too large, whether 50, 65, or 80 kilometers across.
pli-tv-kd2:7.1.6.comm: “Across” is not in the Canonical text, but is supplied from the commentary. Sp 3.140: Tiyojanaparamanti ettha tiyojanaṁ paramaṁ pamāṇametissāti tiyojanaparamā; taṁ tiyojanaparamaṁ. Sammannantena pana majjhe ṭhatvā yathā catūsupi disāsu diyaḍḍhadiyaḍḍhayojanaṁ hoti, evaṁ sammannitabbā. Sace pana majjhe ṭhatvā ekekadisato tiyojanaṁ karonti, chayojanaṁ hotīti na vaṭṭati. Caturassaṁ vā tikoṇaṁ vā sammannantena yathā koṇato koṇaṁ tiyojanaṁ hoti, evaṁ sammannitabbā. Sace hi yena kenaci pariyantena kesaggamattampi tiyojanaṁ atikkāmeti, āpattiñca āpajjati sīmā ca asīmā hoti; “40 kilometers at the most: here 40 kilometers at the most is its measure. This is 40 kilometers at the most. One who is establishing (a monastery zone), standing in the middle, should establish (a zone) that is 20 kilometers in the four directions. If, standing in the middle, he makes it 40 kilometers in each direction, it will be 80 kilometers, which is not allowable. One who is establishing (a zone) that is quadrangular or triangular should establish (a zone) that is 40 kilometers corner to corner. If he exceeds the 40 kilometers even by a hair’s breadth on any side, he commits an offense, and the zone is not actually a monastery zone.”

pli-tv-kd2:7.1.7.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:7.1.8.eng: You should establish a monastery zone that is 40 kilometers across at the most.”
pli-tv-kd2:7.1.8.comm: The Pali for 50, 65, 80, and 40 kilometers is 4, 5, 6, and 3 yojanas respectively. For a discussion of the yojana, see sugata in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd2:7.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū nadīpārasīmaṃ sammannanti.
pli-tv-kd2:7.2.1.eng: At one time the monks from the group of six had established a zone that crossed a river.

pli-tv-kd2:7.2.2.pli: Uposathaṃ āgacchantā bhikkhūpi vuyhanti, pattāpi vuyhanti, cīvarānipi vuyhanti.
pli-tv-kd2:7.2.2.eng: Monks on their way to the observance-day ceremony were swept away by the current, as were their bowls and robes.

pli-tv-kd2:7.2.4.eng: “You shouldn’t establish a monastery zone that crosses a river.

pli-tv-kd2:7.2.5.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:7.2.6.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, yatthassa dhuvanāvā vā dhuvasetu vā, evarūpaṃ nadīpārasīmaṃ sammannitun”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:7.2.6.eng: I allow you to establish a monastery zone that crosses a river only if there is a permanent bridge or ferry connection.”

pli-tv-kd2:8.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū anupariveṇiyaṃ pātimokkhaṃ uddisanti asaṅketena.
pli-tv-kd2:8.1.1.eng: At that time the monks recited the Monastic Code in one yard after another without making a prior arrangement.
pli-tv-kd2:8.1.1.comm: The point seems to be that they recited the pātimokkha in a different place every lunar half-month. Sp 3.141: Anupariveṇiyanti ekasīmamahāvihāre tasmiṁ tasmiṁ pariveṇe, “‘In one yard after another’: in this or that yard within a large monastery inside a single monastery zone.”

pli-tv-kd2:8.1.3.eng: where the observance-day ceremony was to be held.

pli-tv-kd2:8.1.5.eng: “You shouldn’t recite the Monastic Code in one yard after another without making a prior arrangement.

pli-tv-kd2:8.1.6.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:8.1.7.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, uposathāgāraṃ sammannitvā uposathaṃ kātuṃ, yaṃ saṅgho ākaṅkhati vihāraṃ vā aḍḍhayogaṃ vā pāsādaṃ vā hammiyaṃ vā guhaṃ vā.
pli-tv-kd2:8.1.7.eng: I allow you to designate an observance-day hall—whether a dwelling, a stilt house, or a cave—for the observance-day ceremony.
pli-tv-kd2:8.1.7.comm: For an explanation of the renderings “stilt house” and “cave” for pāsāda and guhā respectively, see Appendix of Technical Terms. Apart from vihāra, “a dwelling”, and guhā, “a cave”, the Pali mentions three kinds of buildings, the aḍḍhayoga, the pāsāda, and the hammiya, all of which, according to the commentaries, are different kinds of pāsāda, “stilt houses”. Rather than try to differentiate between these buildings, which is unlikely to be useful from a practical perspective, I have instead grouped them together as “stilt houses”. Here is what the commentaries have to say. Sp 4.294: Aḍḍhayogoti supaṇṇavaṅkagehaṁ, “An aḍḍhayoga is a house bent like a supaṇṇa.” Sp-ṭ 4.294 clarifies: Supaṇṇavaṅkagehanti garuḷapakkhasaṇṭhānena katagehaṁ, “Supaṇṇavaṅkageha: a house made in the shape of the wings of a garuḷa.” A garuḷa, better known in its Sanskrit form garuḍa, is a mythological bird. Sp 4.294 continues: Pāsādoti dīghapāsādo. Hammiyanti upariākāsatale patiṭṭhitakūṭāgāro pāsādoyeva, “A pāsāda is a long stilt house. A hammiya is just a pāsāda that has an upper room on top of its flat roof.” At Sp-ṭ 3.74, however, we find slightly different explanations. It seems clear, however, that all three are stilt houses and that they are distinguished according to their shape and the kind of roof they possess.

pli-tv-kd2:8.1.8.eng: And it should be designated like this.

pli-tv-kd2:8.2.1.eng: A competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd2:8.2.2.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd2:8.2.3.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmaṃ vihāraṃ uposathāgāraṃ sammanneyya.
pli-tv-kd2:8.2.3.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should designate such-and-such a dwelling as the observance-day hall.

pli-tv-kd2:8.2.5.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd2:8.2.6.eng: The Sangha designates such-and-such a dwelling as the observance-day hall.

pli-tv-kd2:8.2.7.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa vihārassa uposathāgārassa sammuti, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd2:8.2.7.eng: Any monk who approves of designating such-and-such a dwelling as the observance-day hall should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd2:8.2.8.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd2:8.2.9.eng: The Sangha has designated such-and-such a dwelling as the observance-day hall.

pli-tv-kd2:8.2.10.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:8.2.10.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-kd2:8.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarasmiṃ āvāse dve uposathāgārāni sammatāni honti.
pli-tv-kd2:8.3.1.eng: Soon afterwards in a certain monastery, they designated two different observance-day halls.

pli-tv-kd2:8.3.3.eng: each group thinking, “The observance-day ceremony will be done here.”

pli-tv-kd2:8.3.5.pli: “Na, bhikkhave, ekasmiṃ āvāse dve uposathāgārāni sammannitabbāni.
pli-tv-kd2:8.3.5.eng: “You shouldn’t designate two different observance-day halls within the same monastery.

pli-tv-kd2:8.3.6.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:8.3.7.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, ekaṃ samūhanitvā ekattha uposathaṃ kātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:8.3.7.eng: You should abolish one of them and do the observance-day ceremony in one place.

pli-tv-kd2:8.4.1.eng: And it should be abolished like this.

pli-tv-kd2:8.4.2.eng: A competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd2:8.4.3.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd2:8.4.4.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmaṃ uposathāgāraṃ samūhaneyya.
pli-tv-kd2:8.4.4.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should abolish such-and-such an observance-day hall.

pli-tv-kd2:8.4.6.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd2:8.4.7.eng: The Sangha abolishes such-and-such an observance-day hall.

pli-tv-kd2:8.4.8.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa uposathāgārassa samugghāto, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd2:8.4.8.eng: Any monk who approves of abolishing such-and-such an observance-day hall should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd2:8.4.9.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd2:8.4.10.eng: The Sangha has abolished such-and-such an observance-day hall.

pli-tv-kd2:8.4.11.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:8.4.11.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-kd2:9.1.0.eng: 6. The allowance for an observance-day forecourt

pli-tv-kd2:9.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarasmiṃ āvāse atikhuddakaṃ uposathāgāraṃ sammataṃ hoti, tadahuposathe mahābhikkhusaṅgho sannipatito hoti.
pli-tv-kd2:9.1.1.eng: At one time in a certain monastery, they had designated an observance-day hall that was too small. On the observance day a large sangha of monks gathered there.

pli-tv-kd2:9.1.2.pli: Bhikkhū asammatāya bhūmiyā nisinnā pātimokkhaṃ assosuṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:9.1.2.eng: Some monks listened to the recitation of the Monastic Code while sitting outside the designated area.

pli-tv-kd2:9.1.4.eng: that the Buddha had laid down a rule

pli-tv-kd2:9.1.5.pli: ‘uposathāgāraṃ sammannitvā uposatho kātabbo’ti, mayañcamhā asammatāya bhūmiyā nisinnā pātimokkhaṃ assumhā, kato nu kho amhākaṃ uposatho, akato nu kho”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:9.1.5.eng: that the observance-day ceremony should be done after designating an observance-day hall, they wondered, “Have we done the observance-day ceremony or not?”

pli-tv-kd2:9.1.7.pli: “Sammatāya vā, bhikkhave, bhūmiyā nisinnā asammatāya vā yato pātimokkhaṃ suṇāti, katovassa uposatho.
pli-tv-kd2:9.1.7.eng: “Whether you listen to the recitation of the Monastic Code while seated within or outside the designated area, in either case you have done the observance-day ceremony.

pli-tv-kd2:9.2.1.pli: Tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho yāva mahantaṃ uposathappamukhaṃ ākaṅkhati, tāva mahantaṃ uposathappamukhaṃ sammannatu.
pli-tv-kd2:9.2.1.eng: Still, the Sangha may designate an observance-day forecourt as large as it likes.
pli-tv-kd2:9.2.1.comm: “Forecourt” renders pamukha. Sp-ṭ 3.142: Uposathappamukhaṁ nāma uposathāgārassa sammukhaṭṭhānaṁ, “The place which is face-to-face with the observance-day hall is called uposathappamukhaṁ.”

pli-tv-kd2:9.2.2.eng: And it should be designated like this.

pli-tv-kd2:9.2.3.eng: First the markers should be announced.

pli-tv-kd2:9.2.4.pli: Nimitte kittetvā byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
pli-tv-kd2:9.2.4.eng: Then a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd2:9.2.5.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd2:9.2.7.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho etehi nimittehi uposathappamukhaṃ sammanneyya.
pli-tv-kd2:9.2.7.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should designate an observance-day forecourt based on the announced markers.

pli-tv-kd2:9.2.9.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd2:9.2.11.eng: The Sangha designates an observance-day forecourt based on the announced markers.

pli-tv-kd2:9.2.12.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati etehi nimittehi uposathappamukhassa sammuti, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd2:9.2.12.eng: Any monk who approves of designating an observance-day forecourt based on these markers should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd2:9.2.13.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd2:9.2.14.eng: The Sangha has designated an observance-day forecourt based on these markers.

pli-tv-kd2:9.2.15.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:9.2.15.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-kd2:10.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahuposathe navakā bhikkhū paṭhamataraṃ sannipatitvā—
pli-tv-kd2:10.1.1.eng: On one occasion, on the observance day in a certain monastery, the junior monks had gathered first. Thinking,

pli-tv-kd2:10.1.2.eng: “There’s no point in being here before the senior monks arrive,”

pli-tv-kd2:10.1.4.eng: As a consequence, the observance-day ceremony was done at the wrong time.

pli-tv-kd2:10.1.6.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, tadahuposathe therehi bhikkhūhi paṭhamataraṃ sannipatitun”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:10.1.6.eng: “On the observance day, the senior monks should gather first.”

pli-tv-kd2:11.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena rājagahe sambahulā āvāsā samānasīmā honti.
pli-tv-kd2:11.1.1.eng: At that time at Rājagaha, there was a number of monasteries within the same monastery zone.

pli-tv-kd2:11.1.3.pli: “amhākaṃ āvāse uposatho karīyatu, amhākaṃ āvāse uposatho karīyatū”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:11.1.3.eng: about where the observance-day ceremony should be done.

pli-tv-kd2:11.1.5.pli: “Idha pana, bhikkhave, sambahulā āvāsā samānasīmā honti.
pli-tv-kd2:11.1.5.eng: “When there are a number of monasteries within the same zone

pli-tv-kd2:11.1.7.pli: ‘amhākaṃ āvāse uposatho karīyatu, amhākaṃ āvāse uposatho karīyatū’ti.
pli-tv-kd2:11.1.7.eng: about where the observance-day ceremony should be done,

pli-tv-kd2:11.1.8.pli: Tehi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi sabbeheva ekajjhaṃ sannipatitvā uposatho kātabbo.
pli-tv-kd2:11.1.8.eng: they should all gather in one place and do the observance-day ceremony there.

pli-tv-kd2:11.1.9.pli: Yattha vā pana thero bhikkhu viharati, tattha sannipatitvā uposatho kātabbo,
pli-tv-kd2:11.1.9.eng: Or they should gather wherever the most senior monk is staying.

pli-tv-kd2:11.1.10.pli: na tveva vaggena saṅghena uposatho kātabbo.
pli-tv-kd2:11.1.10.eng: You shouldn’t do the observance-day ceremony with an incomplete sangha.

pli-tv-kd2:11.1.11.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd2:12.1.0.eng: 7. The allowance for a may-stay-apart zone

pli-tv-kd2:12.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā mahākassapo andhakavindā rājagahaṃ uposathaṃ āgacchanto antarāmagge nadiṃ taranto manaṃ vūḷho ahosi, cīvarānissa allāni.
pli-tv-kd2:12.1.1.eng: On one occasion Venerable Mahākassapa was coming from Andhakavinda to Rājagaha for the observance-day ceremony. As he was crossing a river on the way, he briefly got carried away by the current and his robes got wet.

pli-tv-kd2:12.1.4.pli: “Idhāhaṃ, āvuso, andhakavindā rājagahaṃ uposathaṃ āgacchanto antarāmagge nadiṃ taranto manamhi vūḷho.
pli-tv-kd2:12.1.4.eng: and he told them what had happened.

pli-tv-kd2:12.1.7.pli: “Yā sā, bhikkhave, saṅghena sīmā sammatā samānasaṃvāsā ekuposathā, saṅgho taṃ sīmaṃ ticīvarena avippavāsaṃ sammannatu.
pli-tv-kd2:12.1.7.eng: “When the Sangha has established a monastery zone, defining who belongs to the same community and who should do the observance-day ceremony together, the Sangha may designate this same zone as a may-stay-apart-from-the-three-robes area.

pli-tv-kd2:12.2.1.eng: And it should be designated like this.

pli-tv-kd2:12.2.2.eng: A competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd2:12.2.3.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd2:12.2.4.pli: Yā sā saṅghena sīmā sammatā samānasaṃvāsā ekuposathā, yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ saṅgho taṃ sīmaṃ ticīvarena avippavāsaṃ sammanneyya.
pli-tv-kd2:12.2.4.eng: The Sangha has established a monastery zone, defining who belongs to the same community and who should do the observance-day ceremony together. If the Sangha is ready, it should designate this same zone as a may-stay-apart-from-the-three-robes area.

pli-tv-kd2:12.2.6.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd2:12.2.7.pli: Yā sā saṅghena sīmā sammatā samānasaṃvāsā ekuposathā, saṅgho taṃ sīmaṃ ticīvarena avippavāsaṃ sammannati.
pli-tv-kd2:12.2.7.eng: The Sangha has established a monastery zone, defining who belongs to the same community and who should do the observance-day ceremony together. The Sangha designates this same zone as a may-stay-apart-from-the-three-robes area.

pli-tv-kd2:12.2.8.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati etissā sīmāya ticīvarena avippavāsāya sammuti, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd2:12.2.8.eng: Any monk who approves of designating this monastery zone as a may-stay-apart-from-the-three-robes area should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd2:12.2.9.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd2:12.2.10.pli: Sammatā sā sīmā saṅghena ticīvarena avippavāsā.
pli-tv-kd2:12.2.10.eng: The Sangha has designated this monastery zone as a may-stay-apart-from-the-three-robes area.

pli-tv-kd2:12.2.11.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:12.2.11.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-kd2:12.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū bhagavatā ticīvarena avippavāsasammuti anuññātāti antaraghare cīvarāni nikkhipanti.
pli-tv-kd2:12.3.1.eng: When they heard that the Buddha had allowed the designation of a may-stay-apart-from-the-three-robes area, monks stored their robes in inhabited areas.

pli-tv-kd2:12.3.2.pli: Tāni cīvarāni nassantipi ḍayhantipi undūrehipi khajjanti.
pli-tv-kd2:12.3.2.eng: Their robes were lost, burned, and eaten by rats.

pli-tv-kd2:12.3.3.eng: As a consequence, they had shabby robes.

pli-tv-kd2:12.3.6.pli: “Idha mayaṃ, āvuso, bhagavatā ticīvarena avippavāsasammuti anuññātāti antaraghare cīvarāni nikkhipimhā.
pli-tv-kd2:12.3.6.eng: and they told them what had happened.

pli-tv-kd2:12.3.7.pli: Tāni cīvarāni naṭṭhānipi daḍḍhānipi, undūrehipi khāyitāni, tena mayaṃ duccoḷā lūkhacīvarā”ti.

pli-tv-kd2:12.3.9.pli: “Yā sā, bhikkhave, saṅghena sīmā sammatā samānasaṃvāsā ekuposathā, saṅgho taṃ sīmaṃ ticīvarena avippavāsaṃ sammannatu, ṭhapetvā gāmañca gāmūpacārañca.
pli-tv-kd2:12.3.9.eng: “When the Sangha has established a monastery zone, defining who belongs to the same community and who should do the observance-day ceremony together, the Sangha may designate this same zone as a may-stay-apart-from-the-three-robes area, leaving out inhabited areas and the vicinity of inhabited areas.
pli-tv-kd2:12.3.9.comm: “Vicinity” renders upacāra, while “inhabited area” is for gāma. See Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd2:12.4.1.eng: And it should be designated like this.

pli-tv-kd2:12.4.2.eng: A competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd2:12.4.3.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd2:12.4.4.pli: Yā sā saṅghena sīmā sammatā samānasaṃvāsā ekuposathā yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho taṃ sīmaṃ ticīvarena avippavāsaṃ sammanneyya, ṭhapetvā gāmañca gāmūpacārañca.
pli-tv-kd2:12.4.4.eng: The Sangha has established a monastery zone, defining who belongs to the same community and who should do the observance-day ceremony together. If the Sangha is ready, it should designate this same zone as a may-stay-apart-from-the-three-robes area, leaving out inhabited areas and the vicinity of inhabited areas.

pli-tv-kd2:12.4.6.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd2:12.4.7.pli: Yā sā saṅghena sīmā sammatā samānasaṃvāsā ekuposathā, saṅgho taṃ sīmaṃ ticīvarena avippavāsaṃ sammannati, ṭhapetvā gāmañca gāmūpacārañca.
pli-tv-kd2:12.4.7.eng: The Sangha has established a monastery zone, defining who belongs to the same community and who should do the observance-day ceremony together. The Sangha designates this same zone as a may-stay-apart-from-the-three-robes area, leaving out inhabited areas and the vicinity of inhabited areas.

pli-tv-kd2:12.4.8.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati etissā sīmāya ticīvarena avippavāsāya sammuti, ṭhapetvā gāmañca gāmūpacārañca, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd2:12.4.8.eng: Any monk who approves of designating this monastery zone as a may-stay-apart-from-the-three-robes area, leaving out inhabited areas and the vicinity of inhabited areas, should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd2:12.4.9.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd2:12.4.10.pli: Sammatā sā sīmā saṅghena ticīvarena avippavāsā, ṭhapetvā gāmañca gāmūpacārañca.
pli-tv-kd2:12.4.10.eng: The Sangha has designated this monastery zone as a may-stay-apart-from-the-three-robes area, leaving out inhabited areas and the vicinity of inhabited areas.

pli-tv-kd2:12.4.11.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:12.4.11.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’

pli-tv-kd2:12.5.1.pli: “Sīmaṃ, bhikkhave, sammannantena paṭhamaṃ samānasaṃvāsasīmā sammannitabbā, pacchā ticīvarena avippavāso sammannitabbo.
pli-tv-kd2:12.5.1.eng: “Monks, when you’re establishing a monastery zone, the zone that defines who belongs to the same community should be established first. Afterwards you may designate the may-stay-apart-from-the-three-robes area.

pli-tv-kd2:12.5.2.pli: Sīmaṃ, bhikkhave, samūhanantena paṭhamaṃ ticīvarena avippavāso samūhantabbo, pacchā samānasaṃvāsasīmā samūhantabbā.
pli-tv-kd2:12.5.2.eng: And when you’re abolishing a monastery zone, the may-stay-apart-from-the-three-robes area should be abolished first. Afterwards you may abolish the zone that defines who belongs to the same community.

pli-tv-kd2:12.5.3.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, ticīvarena avippavāso samūhantabbo.
pli-tv-kd2:12.5.3.eng: And this how a may-stay-apart-from-the-three-robes area should be abolished.

pli-tv-kd2:12.5.4.eng: A competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd2:12.5.5.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd2:12.5.6.pli: Yo so saṅghena ticīvarena avippavāso sammato, yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho taṃ ticīvarena avippavāsaṃ samūhaneyya.
pli-tv-kd2:12.5.6.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should abolish this may-stay-apart-from-the-three-robes area.

pli-tv-kd2:12.5.8.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd2:12.5.9.pli: Yo so saṅghena ticīvarena avippavāso sammato, saṅgho taṃ ticīvarena avippavāsaṃ samūhanati.
pli-tv-kd2:12.5.9.eng: The Sangha abolishes this may-stay-apart-from-the-three-robes area.

pli-tv-kd2:12.5.10.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati etassa ticīvarena avippavāsassa samugghāto, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd2:12.5.10.eng: Any monk who approves of abolishing this may-stay-apart-from-the-three-robes area should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd2:12.5.11.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd2:12.5.12.eng: The Sangha has abolished this may-stay-apart-from-the-three-robes area.

pli-tv-kd2:12.5.13.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd2:12.5.13.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’

pli-tv-kd2:12.6.1.eng: And a monastery zone should be abolished like this.

pli-tv-kd2:12.6.2.eng: A competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd2:12.6.3.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd2:12.6.4.pli: Yā sā saṅghena sīmā sammatā samānasaṃvāsā ekuposathā, yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho taṃ sīmaṃ samūhaneyya samānasaṃvāsaṃ ekuposathaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:12.6.4.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should abolish this monastery zone, defining who belongs to the same community and who should do the observance-day ceremony together.

pli-tv-kd2:12.6.6.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd2:12.6.7.pli: Yā sā saṅghena sīmā sammatā samānasaṃvāsā ekuposathā, saṅgho taṃ sīmaṃ samūhanati samānasaṃvāsaṃ ekuposathaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:12.6.7.eng: The Sangha abolishes this monastery zone, defining who belongs to the same community and who should do the observance-day ceremony together.

pli-tv-kd2:12.6.8.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati etissā sīmāya samānasaṃvāsāya ekuposathāya samugghāto, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd2:12.6.8.eng: Any monk who approves of abolishing this monastery zone, defining who belongs to the same community and who should do the observance-day ceremony together, should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd2:12.6.9.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd2:12.6.10.pli: Samūhatā sā sīmā saṅghena samānasaṃvāsā ekuposathā.
pli-tv-kd2:12.6.10.eng: The Sangha has abolished this monastery zone, defining who belongs to the same community and who should do the observance-day ceremony together.

pli-tv-kd2:12.6.11.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:12.6.11.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’

pli-tv-kd2:12.7.1.pli: “Asammatāya, bhikkhave, sīmāya aṭṭhapitāya, yaṃ gāmaṃ vā nigamaṃ vā upanissāya viharati, yā tassa vā gāmassa gāmasīmā, nigamassa vā nigamasīmā, ayaṃ tattha samānasaṃvāsā ekuposathā.
pli-tv-kd2:12.7.1.eng: “There are monks who live supported by inhabited areas where no monastery zone has been established. In these cases, the zone of the inhabited area defines who belongs to the same community and who should do the observance-day ceremony together.

pli-tv-kd2:12.7.2.pli: Agāmake ce, bhikkhave, araññe samantā sattabbhantarā, ayaṃ tattha samānasaṃvāsā ekuposathā.
pli-tv-kd2:12.7.2.eng: If it is an uninhabited area in the wilderness, a distance of 80 meters on all sides defines who belongs to the same community and who should do the observance-day ceremony together.
pli-tv-kd2:12.7.2.comm: That is, seven abbhantaras. For a discussion of the abbhantara, see sugata in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd2:12.7.5.eng: or a whole lake cannot be a monastery zone in its own right.

pli-tv-kd2:12.7.6.pli: Nadiyā vā, bhikkhave, samudde vā jātassare vā yaṃ majjhimassa purisassa samantā udakukkhepā, ayaṃ tattha samānasaṃvāsā ekuposathā”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:12.7.6.eng: In a river, in the ocean, and in a lake, the zone that defines who belongs to the same community and who should do the observance-day ceremony together is the distance an average man can splash water in all directions.”

pli-tv-kd2:13.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū sīmāya sīmaṃ sambhindanti.
pli-tv-kd2:13.1.1.eng: At one time the monks from the group of six established a monastery zone that overlapped with an existing monastery zone.

pli-tv-kd2:13.1.3.pli: “Yesaṃ, bhikkhave, sīmā paṭhamaṃ sammatā tesaṃ taṃ kammaṃ dhammikaṃ akuppaṃ ṭhānārahaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:13.1.3.eng: “The establishment of the first zone is a legitimate legal procedure that is irreversible and fit to stand.

pli-tv-kd2:13.1.4.pli: Yesaṃ, bhikkhave, sīmā pacchā sammatā tesaṃ taṃ kammaṃ adhammikaṃ kuppaṃ aṭṭhānārahaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:13.1.4.eng: The establishment of the subsequent zone is an illegitimate legal procedure that is reversible and unfit to stand.

pli-tv-kd2:13.1.5.eng: You shouldn’t establish a monastery zone that overlaps with an existing monastery zone.

pli-tv-kd2:13.1.6.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd2:13.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū sīmāya sīmaṃ ajjhottharanti.
pli-tv-kd2:13.2.1.eng: At one time the monks from the group of six established a monastery zone that enclosed one existing monastery zone within it.

pli-tv-kd2:13.2.3.pli: “Yesaṃ, bhikkhave, sīmā paṭhamaṃ sammatā tesaṃ taṃ kammaṃ dhammikaṃ akuppaṃ ṭhānārahaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:13.2.3.eng: “The establishment of the first zone is a legitimate legal procedure that is irreversible and fit to stand.

pli-tv-kd2:13.2.4.pli: Yesaṃ, bhikkhave, sīmā pacchā sammatā tesaṃ taṃ kammaṃ adhammikaṃ kuppaṃ aṭṭhānārahaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:13.2.4.eng: The establishment of the subsequent zone is an illegitimate legal procedure that is reversible and unfit to stand.

pli-tv-kd2:13.2.5.eng: You shouldn’t establish a monastery zone that encloses an existing monastery zone.

pli-tv-kd2:13.2.6.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:13.2.7.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, sīmaṃ sammannantena sīmantarikaṃ ṭhapetvā sīmaṃ sammannitun”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:13.2.7.eng: When you establish a monastery zone, you should leave a gap to any existing monastery zone.”

pli-tv-kd2:14.1.0.eng: 10. Breach of the observance-day ceremony, etc.

pli-tv-kd2:14.1.4.pli: “Dveme, bhikkhave, uposathā— cātuddasiko ca pannarasiko ca. Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve uposathā”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:14.1.4.eng: “There are two observance days: the fourteenth and the fifteenth day of the lunar half-month.”

pli-tv-kd2:14.2.2.eng: “How many kinds of observance-day procedures are there?”

pli-tv-kd2:14.2.5.eng: The observance-day procedure that is illegitimate and has an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd2:14.2.6.eng: The observance-day procedure that is illegitimate but has a complete assembly.

pli-tv-kd2:14.2.7.eng: The observance-day procedure that is legitimate but has an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd2:14.2.8.eng: The observance-day procedure that is legitimate and has a complete assembly.

pli-tv-kd2:14.2.9.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yadidaṃ adhammena vaggaṃ uposathakammaṃ, na, bhikkhave, evarūpaṃ uposathakammaṃ kātabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd2:14.2.10.pli: Na ca mayā evarūpaṃ uposathakammaṃ anuññātaṃ.

pli-tv-kd2:14.3.1.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yadidaṃ adhammena samaggaṃ uposathakammaṃ, na, bhikkhave, evarūpaṃ uposathakammaṃ kātabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd2:14.3.2.pli: Na ca mayā evarūpaṃ uposathakammaṃ anuññātaṃ.

pli-tv-kd2:14.3.3.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yadidaṃ dhammena vaggaṃ uposathakammaṃ, na, bhikkhave, evarūpaṃ uposathakammaṃ kātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:14.3.3.eng: and third of these shouldn’t be done;

pli-tv-kd2:14.3.4.pli: Na ca mayā evarūpaṃ uposathakammaṃ anuññātaṃ.

pli-tv-kd2:14.3.5.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yadidaṃ dhammena samaggaṃ uposathakammaṃ, evarūpaṃ, bhikkhave, uposathakammaṃ kātabbaṃ, evarūpañca mayā uposathakammaṃ anuññātaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:14.3.5.eng: The fourth should be done; I have allowed such procedures.

pli-tv-kd2:14.3.6.pli: Tasmātiha, bhikkhave, evarūpaṃ uposathakammaṃ karissāma yadidaṃ dhammena samagganti—
pli-tv-kd2:14.3.6.eng: Therefore, monks, you should train like this: ‘We will do observance-day procedures that are legitimate and have a complete assembly.’”

pli-tv-kd2:15.1.0.eng: 11. The recitation of the Monastic Code in brief, etc.

pli-tv-kd2:15.1.2.eng: “How many ways are there of reciting the Monastic Code?”

pli-tv-kd2:15.1.4.eng: “There are these five ways of reciting the Monastic Code:

pli-tv-kd2:15.1.5.eng: After reciting the introduction, the rest is announced as if heard.

pli-tv-kd2:15.1.7.pli: Nidānaṃ uddisitvā cattāri pārājikāni uddisitvā avasesaṃ sutena sāvetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:15.1.7.eng: After reciting the introduction and the four rules entailing expulsion, the rest is announced as if heard.

pli-tv-kd2:15.1.9.pli: Nidānaṃ uddisitvā cattāri pārājikāni uddisitvā terasa saṅghādisese uddisitvā avasesaṃ sutena sāvetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:15.1.9.eng: After reciting the introduction, the four rules entailing expulsion, and the thirteen rules entailing suspension, the rest is announced as if heard.

pli-tv-kd2:15.1.11.pli: Nidānaṃ uddisitvā cattāri pārājikāni uddisitvā terasa saṅghādisese uddisitvā dve aniyate uddisitvā avasesaṃ sutena sāvetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:15.1.11.eng: After reciting the introduction, the four rules entailing expulsion, the thirteen rules entailing suspension, and the two undetermined rules, the rest is announced as if heard.

pli-tv-kd2:15.2.2.eng: that the Buddha had allowed the recitation of the Monastic Code in brief,

pli-tv-kd2:15.2.3.eng: some monks recited it in brief all the time.

pli-tv-kd2:15.2.5.eng: “You shouldn’t recite the Monastic Code in brief.

pli-tv-kd2:15.2.6.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd2:15.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena kosalesu janapade aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahuposathe savarabhayaṃ ahosi.
pli-tv-kd2:15.3.1.eng: At that time, on the observance day in a certain monastery in the Kosalan country, there was a threat from primitive tribes.
pli-tv-kd2:15.3.1.comm: Sp 3.150: Savarabhayanti aṭavimanussabhayaṁ, “Savarabhayaṁ: threat from forest people.”

pli-tv-kd2:15.3.2.eng: The monks were unable to recite the Monastic Code in full.

pli-tv-kd2:15.3.4.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, sati antarāye saṅkhittena pātimokkhaṃ uddisitun”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:15.3.4.eng: “I allow you to recite the Monastic Code in brief when there are threats.”

pli-tv-kd2:15.4.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū asatipi antarāye saṅkhittena pātimokkhaṃ uddisanti.
pli-tv-kd2:15.4.1.eng: The monks from the group of six recited the Monastic Code in brief even when there were no threats.

pli-tv-kd2:15.4.3.pli: “Na, bhikkhave, asati antarāye saṅkhittena pātimokkhaṃ uddisitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:15.4.3.eng: “You shouldn’t recite the Monastic Code in brief when there are no threats.

pli-tv-kd2:15.4.4.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:15.4.5.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, sati antarāye saṅkhittena pātimokkhaṃ uddisituṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:15.4.5.eng: I allow you to recite the Monastic Code in brief when there are any of these threats:

pli-tv-kd2:15.4.7.pli: rājantarāyo, corantarāyo, agyantarāyo, udakantarāyo, manussantarāyo, amanussantarāyo, vāḷantarāyo, sarīsapantarāyo, jīvitantarāyo, brahmacariyantarāyoti.
pli-tv-kd2:15.4.7.eng: a threat from kings, bandits, fire, floods, people, spirits, predatory animals, or creeping animals, or a threat to life, or a threat to the monastic life.”

pli-tv-kd2:15.4.8.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, evarūpesu antarāyesu saṅkhittena pātimokkhaṃ uddisituṃ, asati antarāye vitthārenā”ti.

pli-tv-kd2:15.5.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū saṅghamajjhe anajjhiṭṭhā dhammaṃ bhāsanti.
pli-tv-kd2:15.5.1.eng: On one occasion the monks from the group of six gave a teaching in the midst of the Sangha without being asked.

pli-tv-kd2:15.5.3.eng: “You shouldn’t give a teaching in the midst of the Sangha without being asked.

pli-tv-kd2:15.5.4.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:15.5.5.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, therena bhikkhunā sāmaṃ vā dhammaṃ bhāsituṃ paraṃ vā ajjhesitun”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:15.5.5.eng: I allow the most senior monk either to give a teaching himself or to ask someone else.”

pli-tv-kd2:15.6.0.eng: 12. Discussion of questioning on the Monastic Law

pli-tv-kd2:15.6.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū saṅghamajjhe asammatā vinayaṃ pucchanti.
pli-tv-kd2:15.6.1.eng: On one occasion the monks from the group of six questioned others on the Monastic Law in the midst of the Sangha without being approved.

pli-tv-kd2:15.6.3.eng: “You shouldn’t question others on the Monastic Law in the midst of the Sangha without being approved.

pli-tv-kd2:15.6.4.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:15.6.5.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, saṅghamajjhe sammatena vinayaṃ pucchituṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:15.6.5.eng: I allow you to question others on the Monastic Law in the midst of the Sangha after being approved.

pli-tv-kd2:15.6.6.eng: And it should be done like this.

pli-tv-kd2:15.6.7.pli: attanā vā attānaṃ sammannitabbaṃ, parena vā paro sammannitabbo.
pli-tv-kd2:15.6.7.eng: One is either approved through oneself or through someone else.

pli-tv-kd2:15.7.1.eng: How is one approved through oneself?

pli-tv-kd2:15.7.2.eng: A competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd2:15.7.3.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd2:15.7.4.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, ahaṃ itthannāmaṃ vinayaṃ puccheyyan’ti.
pli-tv-kd2:15.7.4.eng: If the Sangha is ready, I will question so-and-so on the Monastic Law.’

pli-tv-kd2:15.7.6.eng: And how is one approved through someone else?

pli-tv-kd2:15.7.7.eng: A competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd2:15.7.8.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd2:15.7.9.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, itthannāmo itthannāmaṃ vinayaṃ puccheyyā’ti.
pli-tv-kd2:15.7.9.eng: If the Sangha is ready, so-and-so will question so-and-so on the Monastic Law.’

pli-tv-kd2:15.8.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena pesalā bhikkhū saṅghamajjhe sammatā vinayaṃ pucchanti.
pli-tv-kd2:15.8.1.eng: Soon good monks asked questions on the Monastic Law in the midst of the Sangha after being approved.

pli-tv-kd2:15.8.2.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū labhanti āghātaṃ, labhanti appaccayaṃ, vadhena tajjenti.
pli-tv-kd2:15.8.2.eng: The monks from the group of six became angry and bitter, and they made threats of violence.

pli-tv-kd2:15.8.4.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, saṅghamajjhe sammatenapi parisaṃ oloketvā puggalaṃ tulayitvā vinayaṃ pucchitun”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:15.8.4.eng: “The monk who has been approved should first survey the gathering and evaluate the individuals, and then ask questions on the Monastic Law in the midst of the Sangha.”

pli-tv-kd2:15.9.0.eng: 13. Discussion of replying to questions on the Monastic Law

pli-tv-kd2:15.9.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū saṅghamajjhe asammatā vinayaṃ vissajjenti.
pli-tv-kd2:15.9.1.eng: On one occasion the monks from the group of six replied to questions on the Monastic Law in the midst of the Sangha without being approved.

pli-tv-kd2:15.9.3.eng: “You shouldn’t reply to questions on the Monastic Law in the midst of the Sangha without being approved.

pli-tv-kd2:15.9.4.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:15.9.5.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, saṅghamajjhe sammatena vinayaṃ vissajjetuṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:15.9.5.eng: I allow you to reply to questions on the Monastic Law in the midst of the Sangha after being approved.

pli-tv-kd2:15.9.6.eng: And it should be done like this.

pli-tv-kd2:15.9.7.pli: Attanā vā attānaṃ sammannitabbaṃ, parena vā paro sammannitabbo.
pli-tv-kd2:15.9.7.eng: One is either approved through oneself or through someone else.

pli-tv-kd2:15.10.1.eng: How is one approved through oneself?

pli-tv-kd2:15.10.2.eng: A competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd2:15.10.3.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd2:15.10.4.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, ahaṃ itthannāmena vinayaṃ puṭṭho vissajjeyyan’ti.
pli-tv-kd2:15.10.4.eng: If the Sangha is ready, I will reply when asked by so-and-so on the Monastic Law.’

pli-tv-kd2:15.10.6.eng: And how is one approved through someone else?

pli-tv-kd2:15.10.7.eng: A competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd2:15.10.8.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd2:15.10.9.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, itthannāmo itthannāmena vinayaṃ puṭṭho vissajjeyyā’ti.
pli-tv-kd2:15.10.9.eng: If the Sangha is ready, so-and-so will reply when asked by so-and-so on the Monastic Law.’

pli-tv-kd2:15.11.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena pesalā bhikkhū saṅghamajjhe sammatā vinayaṃ vissajjenti.
pli-tv-kd2:15.11.1.eng: Soon good monks replied to questions on the Monastic Law in the midst of the Sangha after being approved.

pli-tv-kd2:15.11.2.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū labhanti āghātaṃ, labhanti appaccayaṃ, vadhena tajjenti.
pli-tv-kd2:15.11.2.eng: The monks from the group of six became angry and bitter, and they made threats of violence.

pli-tv-kd2:15.11.4.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, saṅghamajjhe sammatenapi parisaṃ oloketvā puggalaṃ tulayitvā vinayaṃ vissajjetun”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:15.11.4.eng: “The monk who has been approved should first survey the gathering and evaluate the individuals, and then reply to questions on the Monastic Law in the midst of the Sangha.”

pli-tv-kd2:16.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū anokāsakataṃ bhikkhuṃ āpattiyā codenti.
pli-tv-kd2:16.1.1.eng: At one time the monks from the group of six accused a monk of an offense without first getting his permission to do so.

pli-tv-kd2:16.1.3.eng: “You shouldn’t accuse a monk of an offense without first getting his permission.

pli-tv-kd2:16.1.4.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:16.1.5.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, okāsaṃ kārāpetvā āpattiyā codetuṃ—
pli-tv-kd2:16.1.5.eng: You should only accuse someone of an offense after getting their permission:

pli-tv-kd2:16.1.6.pli: karotu āyasmā okāsaṃ, ahaṃ taṃ vattukāmo”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:16.1.6.eng: ‘I wish to speak to you, venerable, please give me permission.’”

pli-tv-kd2:16.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena pesalā bhikkhū chabbaggiye bhikkhū okāsaṃ kārāpetvā āpattiyā codenti.
pli-tv-kd2:16.2.1.eng: Soon, after getting their permission, good monks accused the monks from the group of six of an offense.

pli-tv-kd2:16.2.2.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū labhanti āghātaṃ, labhanti appaccayaṃ, vadhena tajjenti.
pli-tv-kd2:16.2.2.eng: The monks from the group of six became angry and bitter, and they made threats of violence.

pli-tv-kd2:16.2.4.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, katepi okāse puggalaṃ tulayitvā āpattiyā codetun”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:16.2.4.eng: “Even when you have their permission, you should first evaluate the individual and then accuse them of an offense.”

pli-tv-kd2:16.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū—“puramhākaṃ pesalā bhikkhū okāsaṃ kārāpentī”ti—paṭikacceva suddhānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ anāpattikānaṃ avatthusmiṃ akāraṇe okāsaṃ kārāpenti.
pli-tv-kd2:16.3.1.eng: At this time the monks from the group of six—thinking to act before the good monks asked them for permission, but having no reason for doing so—got permission from pure monks who had not committed any offenses.

pli-tv-kd2:16.3.3.pli: “Na, bhikkhave, suddhānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ anāpattikānaṃ avatthusmiṃ akāraṇe okāso kārāpetabbo.
pli-tv-kd2:16.3.3.eng: “When there is no reason for doing so, you shouldn’t get permission from pure monks who haven’t committed any offenses.

pli-tv-kd2:16.3.4.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:16.3.5.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, puggalaṃ tulayitvā okāsaṃ kātun”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:16.3.5.eng: And you should give permission only after evaluating the individual.”

pli-tv-kd2:16.4.0.eng: 15. Objecting to an illegitimate legal procedure, etc.

pli-tv-kd2:16.4.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū saṅghamajjhe adhammakammaṃ karonti.
pli-tv-kd2:16.4.1.eng: On one occasion the monks from the group of six did an illegitimate legal procedure in the midst of the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd2:16.4.4.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd2:16.4.7.eng: “You should object when an illegitimate legal procedure is being done.”

pli-tv-kd2:16.5.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena pesalā bhikkhū chabbaggiyehi bhikkhūhi adhammakamme kayiramāne paṭikkosanti.
pli-tv-kd2:16.5.1.eng: Soon afterwards good monks objected when the monks from the group of six did an illegitimate procedure.

pli-tv-kd2:16.5.2.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū labhanti āghātaṃ, labhanti appaccayaṃ, vadhena tajjenti.
pli-tv-kd2:16.5.2.eng: The monks from the group of six became angry and bitter, and they made threats of violence.

pli-tv-kd2:16.5.4.eng: “I also allow you to state your view.”

pli-tv-kd2:16.5.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū labhanti āghātaṃ, labhanti appaccayaṃ, vadhena tajjenti.
pli-tv-kd2:16.5.6.eng: Once again the monks from the group of six became angry and bitter, making threats of violence.

pli-tv-kd2:16.5.8.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, catūhi pañcahi paṭikkosituṃ, dvīhi tīhi diṭṭhiṃ āvikātuṃ, ekena adhiṭṭhātuṃ—
pli-tv-kd2:16.5.8.eng: “A group of four or five should object, a group of two or three may state their view, and a single person may make a silent determination:

pli-tv-kd2:16.6.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū saṅghamajjhe pātimokkhaṃ uddisamānā sañcicca na sāventi.
pli-tv-kd2:16.6.1.eng: On one occasion when the monks from the group of six were reciting the Monastic Code in the midst of the Sangha, they deliberately made themselves inaudible.

pli-tv-kd2:16.6.3.pli: “ Na, bhikkhave, pātimokkhuddesakena sañcicca na sāvetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:16.6.3.eng: “When reciting the Monastic Code, you shouldn’t deliberately make yourselves inaudible.

pli-tv-kd2:16.6.4.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd2:16.7.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā udāyī saṅghassa pātimokkhuddesako hoti kākassarako.
pli-tv-kd2:16.7.1.eng: At one time Venerable Udāyī was the Sangha’s reciter of the Monastic Code, but he had a hoarse voice.

pli-tv-kd2:16.7.3.eng: that the Buddha had laid down a rule

pli-tv-kd2:16.7.4.pli: ‘pātimokkhuddesakena sāvetabban’ti, ahañcamhi kākassarako, kathaṃ nu kho mayā paṭipajjitabban”ti?
pli-tv-kd2:16.7.4.eng: that the reciters of the Monastic Code should make themselves heard, and he thought, ‘I have a hoarse voice. What should I do?’

pli-tv-kd2:16.7.6.eng: “The reciter of the Monastic Code should make an effort

pli-tv-kd2:16.7.8.eng: If you make an effort, there’s no offense.”

pli-tv-kd2:16.8.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena devadatto sagahaṭṭhāya parisāya pātimokkhaṃ uddisati.
pli-tv-kd2:16.8.1.eng: On one occasion Devadatta recited the Monastic Code in a gathering that included lay people.

pli-tv-kd2:16.8.3.eng: “You shouldn’t recite the Monastic Code in a gathering that includes lay people.

pli-tv-kd2:16.8.4.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd2:16.9.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū saṅghamajjhe anajjhiṭṭhā pātimokkhaṃ uddisanti.
pli-tv-kd2:16.9.1.eng: On one occasion the monks from the group of six recited the Monastic Code in the midst of the Sangha without being asked.

pli-tv-kd2:16.9.3.eng: “You shouldn’t recite the Monastic Code in the midst of the Sangha without first being asked to do so.

pli-tv-kd2:16.9.4.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:16.9.5.eng: The most senior monk should be in charge of the recitation of the Monastic Code.”

pli-tv-kd2:16.9.6.eng: The first section for recitation on monastics of other religions is finished.

pli-tv-kd2:17.1.0.eng: 16. Requesting the recitation of the Monastic Code, etc.

pli-tv-kd2:17.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā rājagahe yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena codanāvatthu tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd2:17.1.1.eng: When the Buddha had stayed at Rājagaha for as long as he liked, he set out wandering toward Codanāvatthu.

pli-tv-kd2:17.1.2.pli: Anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena codanāvatthu tadavasari.
pli-tv-kd2:17.1.2.eng: When he eventually arrived, he stayed there.

pli-tv-kd2:17.1.3.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarasmiṃ āvāse sambahulā bhikkhū viharanti.
pli-tv-kd2:17.1.3.eng: At that time a number of monks were staying in a certain monastery

pli-tv-kd2:17.1.4.pli: Tattha thero bhikkhu bālo hoti abyatto.
pli-tv-kd2:17.1.4.eng: where the most senior monk was ignorant and incompetent.

pli-tv-kd2:17.1.5.pli: So na jānāti uposathaṃ vā uposathakammaṃ vā, pātimokkhaṃ vā pātimokkhuddesaṃ vā.
pli-tv-kd2:17.1.5.eng: He did not know about the observance-day ceremony or the observance-day procedure, nor about the Monastic Code or its recitation.

pli-tv-kd2:17.2.2.eng: that the Buddha had laid down a rule

pli-tv-kd2:17.2.3.pli: ‘therādhikaṃ pātimokkhan’ti, ayañca amhākaṃ thero bālo abyatto, na jānāti uposathaṃ vā uposathakammaṃ vā, pātimokkhaṃ vā pātimokkhuddesaṃ vā.
pli-tv-kd2:17.2.3.eng: that the most senior monk should be in charge of the recitation of the Monastic Code,

pli-tv-kd2:17.2.4.eng: and so they wondered what to do.

pli-tv-kd2:17.2.6.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, yo tattha bhikkhu byatto paṭibalo tassādheyyaṃ pātimokkhan”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:17.2.6.eng: “In such a case, a competent and capable monk there should be in charge of the recitation of the Monastic Code.”

pli-tv-kd2:17.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahuposathe sambahulā bhikkhū viharanti bālā abyattā.
pli-tv-kd2:17.3.1.eng: On one occasion on the observance day, a number of ignorant and incompetent monks were staying in a certain monastery.

pli-tv-kd2:17.3.2.pli: Te na jānanti uposathaṃ vā uposathakammaṃ vā, pātimokkhaṃ vā pātimokkhuddesaṃ vā.
pli-tv-kd2:17.3.2.eng: They did not know about the observance-day ceremony or the observance-day procedure, nor about the Monastic Code or its recitation.

pli-tv-kd2:17.3.3.eng: They requested the most senior monk

pli-tv-kd2:17.3.7.eng: They made the same request of the second-most

pli-tv-kd2:17.3.16.eng: each monk in turn until they reached the most junior monk.

pli-tv-kd2:17.3.17.eng: And they all gave the same reply.

pli-tv-kd2:17.4.3.pli: “Idha pana, bhikkhave, aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahuposathe sambahulā bhikkhū viharanti bālā abyattā.
pli-tv-kd2:17.4.3.eng: “When all the monks in a monastery are ignorant and incompetent,

pli-tv-kd2:17.4.4.pli: Te na jānanti uposathaṃ vā uposathakammaṃ vā, pātimokkhaṃ vā pātimokkhuddesaṃ vā.
pli-tv-kd2:17.4.4.eng: and none of them is able to recite the Monastic Code,

pli-tv-kd2:17.5.1.pli: Tehi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi eko bhikkhu sāmantā āvāsā sajjukaṃ pāhetabbo—
pli-tv-kd2:17.5.1.eng: they should straightaway send a monk to a neighboring monastery

pli-tv-kd2:17.5.2.pli: gacchāvuso, saṅkhittena vā vitthārena vā pātimokkhaṃ pariyāpuṇitvāna āgacchāhī”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:17.5.2.eng: to learn the Monastic Code, either in brief or in full.”

pli-tv-kd2:17.6.4.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, therena bhikkhunā navaṃ bhikkhuṃ āṇāpetun”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:17.6.4.eng: “The most senior monk should tell a junior monk to go.”

pli-tv-kd2:17.6.5.pli: Therena āṇattā navā bhikkhū na gacchanti.
pli-tv-kd2:17.6.5.eng: Although told by the senior monk, the junior monks did not go.

pli-tv-kd2:17.6.7.pli: “Na, bhikkhave, therena āṇattena agilānena na gantabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:17.6.7.eng: “If a monk isn’t sick and he’s told by the most senior monk to go, he should go.

pli-tv-kd2:17.6.8.eng: If he doesn’t, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd2:18.1.0.eng: 17. The instruction to learn the number of the lunar half-month, etc.

pli-tv-kd2:18.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā codanāvatthusmiṃ yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā punadeva rājagahaṃ paccāgañchi.
pli-tv-kd2:18.1.1.eng: When he had stayed at Codanāvatthu for as long as he liked, the Buddha returned to Rājagaha.

pli-tv-kd2:18.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena manussā bhikkhū piṇḍāya carante pucchanti—
pli-tv-kd2:18.1.2.eng: Then, while the monks were walking for almsfood, people asked them which half-month it was.

pli-tv-kd2:18.1.7.pli: “pakkhagaṇanamattampime samaṇā sakyaputtiyā na jānanti, kiṃ panime aññaṃ kiñci kalyāṇaṃ jānissantī”ti?
pli-tv-kd2:18.1.7.eng: “These Sakyan monastics don’t even know the number of the lunar half-month. So how could they possibly know anything truly useful?”

pli-tv-kd2:18.1.9.eng: “You should learn the counting of the lunar half-months.”

pli-tv-kd2:18.2.2.eng: “Who should learn the counting of the lunar half-months?”

pli-tv-kd2:18.2.4.eng: “You should all learn the counting of the lunar half-months.”

pli-tv-kd2:18.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena manussā bhikkhū piṇḍāya carante pucchanti—
pli-tv-kd2:18.3.1.eng: On another occasion, while the monks were walking for almsfood, people asked them how many monks there were.

pli-tv-kd2:18.3.6.pli: “aññamaññampime samaṇā sakyaputtiyā na jānanti, kiṃ panime aññaṃ kiñci kalyāṇaṃ jānissantī”ti?
pli-tv-kd2:18.3.6.eng: “These Sakyan monastics don’t even know about one another. So how could they possibly know anything truly useful?”

pli-tv-kd2:18.4.4.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, tadahuposathe nāmaggena vā gaṇetuṃ, salākaṃ vā gāhetun”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:18.4.4.eng: “You should count the monks on the observance day, either by name or by distributing tickets.”
pli-tv-kd2:18.4.4.comm: “By name” renders the obscure compound nāmaggena. The commentaries are silent. Alternative readings include nāmamattena, gaṇamaggena, and nasamaggena, none of which is an obvious fit for the current context.

pli-tv-kd2:19.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū ajānantā ajjuposathoti dūraṃ gāmaṃ piṇḍāya caranti.
pli-tv-kd2:19.1.1.eng: On one occasion, monks walked for almsfood in a faraway village, not knowing that it was the observance day.

pli-tv-kd2:19.1.2.pli: Te uddissamānepi pātimokkhe āgacchanti, uddiṭṭhamattepi āgacchanti.
pli-tv-kd2:19.1.2.eng: They arrived back while the Monastic Code was being recited or even just after.

pli-tv-kd2:19.1.4.eng: “You should announce, ‘Today is the observance day.’”

pli-tv-kd2:19.1.8.eng: “The most senior monk should make the announcement early in the morning.”

pli-tv-kd2:19.1.9.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro thero kālavato nassarati.
pli-tv-kd2:19.1.9.eng: Soon afterwards a certain senior monk forgot to make the announcement early in the morning.

pli-tv-kd2:19.1.11.eng: “I allow you to make the announcement at the mealtime too.”

pli-tv-kd2:19.1.12.eng: He forgot to make the announcement at the mealtime too.

pli-tv-kd2:19.1.14.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, yaṃ kālaṃ sarati, taṃ kālaṃ ārocetun”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:19.1.14.eng: “I allow you to make the announcement whenever you remember.”

pli-tv-kd2:20.1.0.eng: 18. The instruction to do the prior duties

pli-tv-kd2:20.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarasmiṃ āvāse uposathāgāraṃ uklāpaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd2:20.1.1.eng: On one occasion in a certain monastery, the observance-day hall was dirty.

pli-tv-kd2:20.1.3.pli: “kathañhi nāma āvāsikā bhikkhū uposathāgāraṃ na sammajjissantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:20.1.3.eng: “Why don’t the resident monks sweep the hall?”

pli-tv-kd2:20.2.4.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, therena bhikkhunā navaṃ bhikkhuṃ āṇāpetun”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:20.2.4.eng: “The most senior monk should tell a junior monk.”

pli-tv-kd2:20.2.5.pli: Therena āṇattā navā bhikkhū na sammajjanti.
pli-tv-kd2:20.2.5.eng: Although told by the senior monk, the junior monks did not sweep.

pli-tv-kd2:20.2.7.pli: “Na, bhikkhave, therena āṇattena agilānena na sammajjitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:20.2.7.eng: “If a monk isn’t sick and he’s told by the senior monk to sweep, he should sweep.

pli-tv-kd2:20.2.8.eng: If he doesn’t, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd2:20.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena uposathāgāre āsanaṃ apaññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd2:20.3.1.eng: On one occasion no seats were prepared in the observance-day hall.

pli-tv-kd2:20.3.2.pli: Bhikkhū chamāyaṃ nisīdanti, gattānipi cīvarānipi paṃsukitāni honti.
pli-tv-kd2:20.3.2.eng: The monks sat on the ground. They became dirty, as did their robes.

pli-tv-kd2:20.3.4.eng: “You should prepare seats in the observance-day hall.”

pli-tv-kd2:20.3.8.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, therena bhikkhunā navaṃ bhikkhuṃ āṇāpetun”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:20.3.8.eng: “The most senior monk should tell a junior monk.”

pli-tv-kd2:20.3.9.pli: Therena āṇattā navā bhikkhū na paññapenti.
pli-tv-kd2:20.3.9.eng: Although told by the senior monk, the junior monks did not prepare them.

pli-tv-kd2:20.3.11.pli: “Na, bhikkhave, therena āṇattena agilānena na paññapetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:20.3.11.eng: “If a monk isn’t sick and he’s told by the senior monk to prepare the seats, he should do so.

pli-tv-kd2:20.3.12.eng: If he doesn’t, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd2:20.4.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena uposathāgāre padīpo na hoti.
pli-tv-kd2:20.4.1.eng: On one occasion there was no lamp in the observance-day hall.

pli-tv-kd2:20.4.2.eng: Because it was dark, the monks stepped on one another and on one another’s robes.

pli-tv-kd2:20.4.4.eng: “You should light a lamp in the observance-day hall.”

pli-tv-kd2:20.4.8.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, therena bhikkhunā navaṃ bhikkhuṃ āṇāpetun”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:20.4.8.eng: “The most senior monk should tell a junior monk.”

pli-tv-kd2:20.4.9.pli: Therena āṇattā navā bhikkhū na padīpenti.
pli-tv-kd2:20.4.9.eng: Although told by the senior monk, the junior monks did not light a lamp.

pli-tv-kd2:20.4.11.pli: “Na, bhikkhave, therena āṇattena agilānena na padīpetabbo.
pli-tv-kd2:20.4.11.eng: “If a monk isn’t sick and he’s told by the senior monk to light a lamp, he should do so.

pli-tv-kd2:20.4.12.eng: If he doesn’t, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd2:20.5.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarasmiṃ āvāse āvāsikā bhikkhū neva pānīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpenti, na paribhojanīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpenti.
pli-tv-kd2:20.5.1.eng: On one occasion in a certain monastery, the resident monks didn’t set out water for drinking or water for washing.

pli-tv-kd2:20.5.2.eng: Newly-arrived monks complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd2:20.5.3.pli: “kathañhi nāma āvāsikā bhikkhū neva pānīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpessanti, na paribhojanīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpessantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:20.5.3.eng: “Why don’t the resident monks set out water for drinking and water for washing?”

pli-tv-kd2:20.5.5.eng: “You should set out water for drinking and water for washing.”

pli-tv-kd2:20.6.4.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, therena bhikkhunā navaṃ bhikkhuṃ āṇāpetun”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:20.6.4.eng: “The most senior monk should tell a junior monk.”

pli-tv-kd2:20.6.5.pli: Therena āṇattā navā bhikkhū na upaṭṭhāpenti.
pli-tv-kd2:20.6.5.eng: Although told by the senior monk, the junior monks did not do it.

pli-tv-kd2:20.6.7.pli: “Na, bhikkhave, therena āṇattena agilānena na upaṭṭhāpetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:20.6.7.eng: “If a monk isn’t sick and he’s told by the senior monk to set them out, he should do so.

pli-tv-kd2:20.6.8.eng: If he doesn’t, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd2:21.1.0.eng: 19. Those going to a different region, etc.

pli-tv-kd2:21.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū bālā abyattā disaṅgamikā ācariyupajjhāye āpucchiṃsu.
