pli-tv-kd2:21.1.1.eng: On one occasion a number of ignorant and incompetent monks asked permission from their teachers and preceptors to go to a different region.

pli-tv-kd2:21.1.3.pli: “Idha pana, bhikkhave, sambahulā bhikkhū bālā abyattā disaṅgamikā ācariyupajjhāye āpucchanti.
pli-tv-kd2:21.1.3.eng: “A number of ignorant and incompetent monks might ask their teachers and preceptors for permission to go to a different region.

pli-tv-kd2:21.1.4.eng: The teachers and preceptors should then ask them

pli-tv-kd2:21.1.5.eng: where they’re going and who they’re going with.

pli-tv-kd2:21.1.6.pli: Te ce, bhikkhave, bālā abyattā aññe bāle abyatte apadiseyyuṃ, na, bhikkhave, ācariyupajjhāyehi anujānitabbā.
pli-tv-kd2:21.1.6.eng: If they’re going with others who are ignorant and incompetent, the teachers and preceptors shouldn’t give them permission.

pli-tv-kd2:21.1.7.eng: If they do, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:21.1.8.pli: Te ca, bhikkhave, bālā abyattā ananuññātā ācariyupajjhāyehi gaccheyyuñce, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-kd2:21.1.8.eng: And if the students go without permission from their teachers and preceptors, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:21.2.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, aññatarasmiṃ āvāse sambahulā bhikkhū viharanti bālā abyattā.
pli-tv-kd2:21.2.1.eng: A number of ignorant and incompetent monks may be staying in a certain monastery.

pli-tv-kd2:21.2.2.pli: Te na jānanti uposathaṃ vā uposathakammaṃ vā, pātimokkhaṃ vā pātimokkhuddesaṃ vā.
pli-tv-kd2:21.2.2.eng: They don’t know about the observance-day ceremony or the observance-day procedure, nor about the Monastic Code or its recitation.

pli-tv-kd2:21.2.3.pli: Tattha añño bhikkhu āgacchati bahussuto āgatāgamo dhammadharo vinayadharo mātikādharo paṇḍito byatto medhāvī lajjī kukkuccako sikkhākāmo.
pli-tv-kd2:21.2.3.eng: Then a monk arrives who is learned and a master of the tradition; who is an expert on the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Key Terms; who is knowledgeable and competent, has a sense of conscience, and is afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training.
pli-tv-kd2:21.2.3.comm: Mātikā, “Key Terms”, probably refers to the two Pātimokkhas. Sp 5.325: Pātimokkhanti dve mātikā na jānāti, “Pātimokkha: he does not know the two (collections of) Key Terms.”

pli-tv-kd2:21.2.4.pli: Tehi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi so bhikkhu saṅgahetabbo anuggahetabbo upalāpetabbo upaṭṭhāpetabbo cuṇṇena mattikāya dantakaṭṭhena mukhodakena.
pli-tv-kd2:21.2.4.eng: Those monks should treat that learned monk with kindness. They should assist him and befriend him, and they should attend on him with bath powder, soap, tooth cleaners, and water for rinsing the mouth.
pli-tv-kd2:21.2.4.comm: For an explanation of rendering cuṇṇa and mattika as respectively “bath powder” and “soap”, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd2:21.2.5.pli: No ce saṅgaṇheyyuṃ anuggaṇheyyuṃ upalāpeyyuṃ upaṭṭhāpeyyuṃ cuṇṇena mattikāya dantakaṭṭhena mukhodakena, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-kd2:21.2.5.eng: If they don’t look after him in this way, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:21.3.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahuposathe sambahulā bhikkhū viharanti bālā abyattā.
pli-tv-kd2:21.3.1.eng: On the observance day, a number of ignorant and incompetent monks may be staying in a certain monastery.

pli-tv-kd2:21.3.2.pli: Te na jānanti uposathaṃ vā uposathakammaṃ vā, pātimokkhaṃ vā pātimokkhuddesaṃ vā.
pli-tv-kd2:21.3.2.eng: They don’t know about the observance-day ceremony or the observance-day procedure, nor about the Monastic Code or its recitation.

pli-tv-kd2:21.3.3.pli: Tehi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi eko bhikkhu sāmantā āvāsā sajjukaṃ pāhetabbo—
pli-tv-kd2:21.3.3.eng: They should straightaway send a monk to a neighboring monastery

pli-tv-kd2:21.3.4.pli: ‘gacchāvuso, saṅkhittena vā vitthārena vā pātimokkhaṃ pariyāpuṇitvā āgacchā’ti.
pli-tv-kd2:21.3.4.eng: to learn the Monastic Code, either in brief or in full.

pli-tv-kd2:21.3.5.eng: If he’s able to do this, it’s good.

pli-tv-kd2:21.3.6.pli: No ce labhetha, tehi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi sabbeheva yattha jānanti uposathaṃ vā uposathakammaṃ vā pātimokkhaṃ vā pātimokkhuddesaṃ vā, so āvāso gantabbo.
pli-tv-kd2:21.3.6.eng: If he’s not, then those monks should all go to a monastery where the monks know about the observance-day ceremony and the observance-day procedure, and about the Monastic Code and its recitation.

pli-tv-kd2:21.3.7.eng: If they don’t go, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:21.4.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, aññatarasmiṃ āvāse sambahulā bhikkhū vassaṃ vasanti bālā abyattā.
pli-tv-kd2:21.4.1.eng: A number of ignorant and incompetent monks may be spending the rainy-season residence in a certain monastery.

pli-tv-kd2:21.4.2.pli: Te na jānanti uposathaṃ vā uposathakammaṃ vā pātimokkhaṃ vā pātimokkhuddesaṃ vā.
pli-tv-kd2:21.4.2.eng: They don’t know about the observance-day ceremony or the observance-day procedure, nor about the Monastic Code or its recitation.

pli-tv-kd2:21.4.3.pli: Tehi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi eko bhikkhu sāmantā āvāsā sajjukaṃ pāhetabbo—
pli-tv-kd2:21.4.3.eng: They should straightaway send a monk to a neighboring monastery

pli-tv-kd2:21.4.4.pli: ‘gacchāvuso, saṅkhittena vā vitthārena vā pātimokkhaṃ pariyāpuṇitvā āgacchā’ti.
pli-tv-kd2:21.4.4.eng: to learn the Monastic Code, either in brief or in full.

pli-tv-kd2:21.4.5.eng: If he’s able to do this, it’s good.

pli-tv-kd2:21.4.6.pli: No ce labhetha, eko bhikkhu sattāhakālikaṃ pāhetabbo—
pli-tv-kd2:21.4.6.eng: If he’s not, then a monk should be sent under the seven-day allowance

pli-tv-kd2:21.4.7.pli: ‘gacchāvuso, saṅkhittena vā vitthārena vā pātimokkhaṃ pariyāpuṇitvā āgacchā’ti.
pli-tv-kd2:21.4.7.eng: to learn the Monastic Code, either in brief or in full.

pli-tv-kd2:21.4.8.eng: If he’s able to do this, it’s good.

pli-tv-kd2:21.4.9.pli: No ce labhetha, na, bhikkhave, tehi bhikkhūhi tasmiṃ āvāse vassaṃ vasitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:21.4.9.eng: If he’s not, then those monks shouldn’t spend the rainy-season residence in that monastery.

pli-tv-kd2:21.4.10.eng: If they do, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd2:22.1.0.eng: 20. Discussion of the passing on of purity

pli-tv-kd2:22.1.1.eng: Then the Buddha addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd2:22.1.2.eng: “Gather, monks, for the Sangha to do the observance-day ceremony.”

pli-tv-kd2:22.1.3.pli: Evaṃ vutte, aññataro bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd2:22.1.3.eng: A monk said to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd2:22.1.4.eng: “Sir, there’s a sick monk. He hasn’t come.”

pli-tv-kd2:22.1.5.eng: “A sick monk should pass on his purity.

pli-tv-kd2:22.1.6.eng: And he should do it like this.

pli-tv-kd2:22.1.7.pli: tena gilānena bhikkhunā ekaṃ bhikkhuṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd2:22.1.7.eng: The sick monk should approach a monk, arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, and squat on his heels. He should then raise his joined palms and say,

pli-tv-kd2:22.1.8.pli: ‘pārisuddhiṃ dammi, pārisuddhiṃ me hara, pārisuddhiṃ me ārocehī’ti.
pli-tv-kd2:22.1.8.eng: ‘I pass on my purity; please convey my purity; please announce my purity.’

pli-tv-kd2:22.1.9.pli: Kāyena viññāpeti, vācāya viññāpeti, kāyena vācāya viññāpeti, dinnā hoti pārisuddhi.
pli-tv-kd2:22.1.9.eng: If he makes this understood by body, by speech, or by body and speech, then the purity has been passed on.

pli-tv-kd2:22.1.10.pli: Na kāyena viññāpeti, na vācāya viññāpeti, na kāyena vācāya viññāpeti, na dinnā hoti pārisuddhi.
pli-tv-kd2:22.1.10.eng: If he doesn’t make this understood by body, by speech, or by body and speech, then the purity hasn’t been passed on.

pli-tv-kd2:22.2.1.eng: If he’s able to do this, it’s good.

pli-tv-kd2:22.2.2.pli: No ce labhetha, so, bhikkhave, gilāno bhikkhu mañcena vā pīṭhena vā saṅghamajjhe ānetvā uposatho kātabbo.
pli-tv-kd2:22.2.2.eng: If he’s not, then the sick monk should be brought into the midst of the Sangha together with his bed or bench. They can then do the observance-day ceremony.

pli-tv-kd2:22.2.3.pli: Sace, bhikkhave, gilānupaṭṭhākānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ evaṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd2:22.2.3.eng: But if the one who is nursing him says,

pli-tv-kd2:22.2.4.pli: ‘sace kho mayaṃ gilānaṃ ṭhānā cāvessāma, ābādho vā abhivaḍḍhissati kālaṅkiriyā vā bhavissatī’ti, na, bhikkhave, gilāno bhikkhu ṭhānā cāvetabbo.
pli-tv-kd2:22.2.4.eng: ‘If we move him, his illness will get worse, or he’ll die,’ then the sick monk shouldn’t be moved.

pli-tv-kd2:22.2.5.eng: The Sangha should go to where the sick monk is and do the observance-day ceremony there.

pli-tv-kd2:22.2.6.pli: Na tveva vaggena saṅghena uposatho kātabbo.
pli-tv-kd2:22.2.6.eng: You shouldn’t do the observance-day ceremony with an incomplete Sangha.

pli-tv-kd2:22.2.7.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:22.3.1.pli: Pārisuddhihārako ce, bhikkhave, dinnāya pārisuddhiyā tattheva pakkamati, aññassa dātabbā pārisuddhi.
pli-tv-kd2:22.3.1.eng: If, after the purity has been passed on to him, the monk who is conveying the purity goes away right then and there, then the purity should be passed on to someone else.
pli-tv-kd2:22.3.1.comm: Sp 3.164: Tattheva pakkamatīti saṅghamajjhaṁ anāgantvā tatova katthaci gacchati, “Tattheva pakkamati: not having gone to the midst of the Sangha, he goes wherever.”

pli-tv-kd2:22.3.2.pli: Pārisuddhihārako ce, bhikkhave, dinnāya pārisuddhiyā tattheva vibbhamati …pe…
pli-tv-kd2:22.3.2.eng: If, after the purity has been passed on to him, the monk who is conveying the purity disrobes right then and there,

pli-tv-kd2:22.3.4.eng: admits right then and there that he’s a novice monk,

pli-tv-kd2:22.3.5.eng: admits right then and there that he’s renounced the training,

pli-tv-kd2:22.3.6.eng: admits right then and there that he’s committed the worst kind of offense,

pli-tv-kd2:22.3.7.eng: admits right then and there that he’s insane,

pli-tv-kd2:22.3.8.eng: admits right then and there that he’s deranged,

pli-tv-kd2:22.3.9.eng: admits right then and there that he’s overwhelmed by pain,

pli-tv-kd2:22.3.10.eng: admits right then and there that he’s been ejected for not recognizing an offense,

pli-tv-kd2:22.3.11.eng: admits right then and there that he’s been ejected for not making amends for an offense,

pli-tv-kd2:22.3.12.eng: admits right then and there that he’s been ejected for not giving up a bad view,

pli-tv-kd2:22.3.13.eng: admits right then and there that he’s a paṇḍaka,

pli-tv-kd2:22.3.14.eng: admits right then and there that he’s a fake monk,

pli-tv-kd2:22.3.15.eng: admits right then and there that he’s previously left to join the monastics of another religion,

pli-tv-kd2:22.3.16.eng: admits right then and there that he’s an animal,

pli-tv-kd2:22.3.17.eng: admits right then and there that he’s a matricide,

pli-tv-kd2:22.3.18.eng: admits right then and there that he’s a patricide,

pli-tv-kd2:22.3.19.eng: admits right then and there that he’s a murderer of a perfected one,

pli-tv-kd2:22.3.20.eng: admits right then and there that he’s raped a nun,
pli-tv-kd2:22.3.20.comm: “Raped” renders dūsaka. See Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd2:22.3.21.eng: admits right then and there that he’s caused a schism in the Sangha,

pli-tv-kd2:22.3.22.eng: admits right then and there that he’s caused the Buddha to bleed,

pli-tv-kd2:22.3.23.eng: or admits right then and there that he’s a hermaphrodite, then the purity should be passed on to someone else.

pli-tv-kd2:22.4.1.pli: Pārisuddhihārako ce, bhikkhave, dinnāya pārisuddhiyā antarāmagge pakkamati, anāhaṭā hoti pārisuddhi.
pli-tv-kd2:22.4.1.eng: If, after the purity has been passed on to him, the monk who is conveying the purity goes away while on his way to the observance-day ceremony, then the purity hasn’t been brought.

pli-tv-kd2:22.4.2.pli: Pārisuddhihārako ce, bhikkhave, dinnāya pārisuddhiyā antarāmagge vibbhamati …pe…
pli-tv-kd2:22.4.2.eng: If, after the purity has been passed on to him, the monk who is conveying the purity disrobes while on his way to the observance-day ceremony …

pli-tv-kd2:22.4.3.eng: or admits that he’s a hermaphrodite while on his way to the observance-day ceremony, then the purity hasn’t been brought.

pli-tv-kd2:22.4.4.pli: Pārisuddhihārako ce, bhikkhave, dinnāya pārisuddhiyā saṅghappatto pakkamati, āhaṭā hoti pārisuddhi.
pli-tv-kd2:22.4.4.eng: But if, after the purity has been passed on to him, the monk who is conveying the purity goes away after reaching the Sangha, then the purity has been brought.

pli-tv-kd2:22.4.5.pli: Pārisuddhihārako ce, bhikkhave, dinnāya pārisuddhiyā saṅghappatto vibbhamati …pe…
pli-tv-kd2:22.4.5.eng: And if, after the purity has been passed on to him, the monk who is conveying the purity disrobes after reaching the Sangha …

pli-tv-kd2:22.4.6.eng: or admits that he’s a hermaphrodite after reaching the Sangha, then the purity has been brought.

pli-tv-kd2:22.4.7.pli: Pārisuddhihārako ce, bhikkhave, dinnāya pārisuddhiyā saṅghappatto sutto na āroceti, pamatto na āroceti, samāpanno na āroceti, āhaṭā hoti pārisuddhi.
pli-tv-kd2:22.4.7.eng: And if, after the purity has been passed on to him, the monk who is conveying the purity reaches the Sangha, but doesn’t announce the purity because he falls asleep or is heedless or gains a meditation attainment, then the purity has been brought.

pli-tv-kd2:22.4.8.eng: There’s no offense for the one who is conveying the purity.

pli-tv-kd2:22.4.9.pli: Pārisuddhihārako ce, bhikkhave, dinnāya pārisuddhiyā saṅghappatto sañcicca na āroceti, āhaṭā hoti pārisuddhi.
pli-tv-kd2:22.4.9.eng: And if, after the purity has been passed on to him, the monk who is conveying the purity reaches the Sangha, but deliberately doesn’t announce the purity, then the purity has been brought.

pli-tv-kd2:22.4.10.eng: But there’s an offense of wrong conduct for the one who is conveying the purity.”

pli-tv-kd2:23.1.2.eng: “Gather, monks, for the Sangha to do a legal procedure.”

pli-tv-kd2:23.1.3.pli: Evaṃ vutte, aññataro bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd2:23.1.3.eng: A monk said to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd2:23.1.4.eng: “Sir, there’s a sick monk. He hasn’t come.”

pli-tv-kd2:23.1.5.eng: “A sick monk should give his consent.

pli-tv-kd2:23.1.6.eng: And he should give like this.

pli-tv-kd2:23.1.7.pli: Tena gilānena bhikkhunā ekaṃ bhikkhuṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd2:23.1.7.eng: The sick monk should approach a monk, arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, and squat on his heels. He should then raise his joined palms and say,

pli-tv-kd2:23.1.8.pli: ‘chandaṃ dammi, chandaṃ me hara, chandaṃ me ārocehī’ti.
pli-tv-kd2:23.1.8.eng: ‘I give my consent; please convey my consent; please announce my consent.’

pli-tv-kd2:23.1.9.pli: Kāyena viññāpeti, vācāya viññāpeti, kāyena vācāya viññāpeti, dinno hoti chando.
pli-tv-kd2:23.1.9.eng: If he makes this understood by body, by speech, or by body and speech, then the consent has been given.

pli-tv-kd2:23.1.10.pli: Na kāyena viññāpeti, na vācāya viññāpeti, na kāyena vācāya viññāpeti, na dinno hoti chando.
pli-tv-kd2:23.1.10.eng: If he doesn’t make this understood by body, by speech, or by body and speech, then the consent hasn’t been given.

pli-tv-kd2:23.2.1.eng: If he’s able to do this, it’s good.

pli-tv-kd2:23.2.2.pli: No ce labhetha, so, bhikkhave, gilāno bhikkhu mañcena vā pīṭhena vā saṅghamajjhe ānetvā kammaṃ kātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:23.2.2.eng: If he’s not, then the sick monk should be brought into the midst of the Sangha together with his bed or bench. They can then do the procedure.

pli-tv-kd2:23.2.3.pli: Sace, bhikkhave, gilānupaṭṭhākānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ evaṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd2:23.2.3.eng: But if the one who is nursing him says,

pli-tv-kd2:23.2.4.pli: ‘sace kho mayaṃ gilānaṃ ṭhānā cāvessāma, ābādho vā abhivaḍḍhissati kālaṅkiriyā vā bhavissatī’ti, na, bhikkhave, gilāno bhikkhu ṭhānā cāvetabbo.
pli-tv-kd2:23.2.4.eng: ‘If we move him, his illness will get worse, or he’ll die,’ then the sick monk shouldn’t be moved.

pli-tv-kd2:23.2.5.eng: The Sangha should go to where the sick monk is and do the procedure there.

pli-tv-kd2:23.2.6.pli: Na tveva vaggena saṅghena kammaṃ kātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:23.2.6.eng: You shouldn’t do a legal procedure with an incomplete sangha.

pli-tv-kd2:23.2.7.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:23.3.1.pli: Chandahārako ce, bhikkhave, dinne chande tattheva pakkamati, aññassa dātabbo chando.
pli-tv-kd2:23.3.1.eng: If, after the consent has been given to him, the monk who is conveying the consent goes away right then and there, then the consent should be given to someone else.

pli-tv-kd2:23.3.2.pli: Chandahārako ce, bhikkhave, dinne chande tattheva vibbhamati …pe…
pli-tv-kd2:23.3.2.eng: If, after the consent has been given to him, the monk who is conveying the consent disrobes right then and there,

pli-tv-kd2:23.3.4.eng: admits right then and there that he’s a novice monk,

pli-tv-kd2:23.3.5.eng: admits right then and there that he’s renounced the training,

pli-tv-kd2:23.3.6.eng: admits right then and there that he’s committed the worst kind of offense,

pli-tv-kd2:23.3.7.eng: admits right then and there that he’s insane,

pli-tv-kd2:23.3.8.eng: admits right then and there that he’s deranged,

pli-tv-kd2:23.3.9.eng: admits right then and there that he’s overwhelmed by pain,

pli-tv-kd2:23.3.10.eng: admits right then and there that he’s been ejected for not recognizing an offense,

pli-tv-kd2:23.3.11.eng: admits right then and there that he’s been ejected for not making amends for an offense,

pli-tv-kd2:23.3.12.eng: admits right then and there that he’s been ejected for not giving up a bad view,

pli-tv-kd2:23.3.13.eng: admits right then and there that he’s a paṇḍaka,

pli-tv-kd2:23.3.14.eng: admits right then and there that he’s a fake monk,

pli-tv-kd2:23.3.15.eng: admits right then and there that he’s previously left to join the monastics of another religion,

pli-tv-kd2:23.3.16.eng: admits right then and there that he’s an animal,

pli-tv-kd2:23.3.17.eng: admits right then and there that he’s a matricide,

pli-tv-kd2:23.3.18.eng: admits right then and there that he’s a patricide,

pli-tv-kd2:23.3.19.eng: admits right then and there that he’s a murderer of a perfected one,

pli-tv-kd2:23.3.20.eng: admits right then and there that he’s raped a nun,

pli-tv-kd2:23.3.21.eng: admits right then and there that he’s caused a schism in the Sangha,

pli-tv-kd2:23.3.22.eng: admits right then and there that he’s caused the Buddha to bleed,

pli-tv-kd2:23.3.23.eng: or admits right then and there that he’s a hermaphrodite, then the consent should be given to someone else.

pli-tv-kd2:23.3.24.pli: Chandahārako ce, bhikkhave, dinne chande antarāmagge pakkamati, anāhaṭo hoti chando.
pli-tv-kd2:23.3.24.eng: If, after the consent has been given to him, the monk who is conveying the consent goes away while on his way to the legal procedure, then the consent hasn’t been brought.

pli-tv-kd2:23.3.25.pli: Chandahārako ce, bhikkhave, dinne chande antarāmagge vibbhamati …pe…
pli-tv-kd2:23.3.25.eng: If, after the consent has been given to him, the monk who is conveying the consent disrobes while on his way to the legal procedure …

pli-tv-kd2:23.3.26.eng: or admits that he’s a hermaphrodite while on his way to the legal procedure, then the consent hasn’t been brought.

pli-tv-kd2:23.3.27.pli: Chandahārako ce, bhikkhave, dinne chande saṅghappatto pakkamati, āhaṭo hoti chando.
pli-tv-kd2:23.3.27.eng: But if, after the consent has been given to him, the monk who is conveying the consent goes away after reaching the Sangha, then the consent has been brought.

pli-tv-kd2:23.3.28.pli: Chandahārako ce, bhikkhave, dinne chande saṅghappatto vibbhamati …pe…
pli-tv-kd2:23.3.28.eng: And if, after the consent has been given to him, the monk who is conveying the consent disrobes after reaching the Sangha …

pli-tv-kd2:23.3.29.eng: or admits that he’s a hermaphrodite after reaching the Sangha, then the consent has been brought.

pli-tv-kd2:23.3.30.pli: Chandahārako ce, bhikkhave, dinne chande saṅghappatto sutto na āroceti, pamatto na āroceti, samāpanno na āroceti, āhaṭo hoti chando.
pli-tv-kd2:23.3.30.eng: And if, after the consent has been given to him, the monk who is conveying the consent reaches the Sangha, but doesn’t announce the consent because he falls asleep or is heedless or gains a meditation attainment, then the consent has been brought.

pli-tv-kd2:23.3.31.eng: There’s no offense for the one who is conveying the consent.

pli-tv-kd2:23.3.32.pli: Chandahārako ce, bhikkhave, dinne chande saṅghappatto sañcicca na āroceti, āhaṭo hoti chando.
pli-tv-kd2:23.3.32.eng: And if, after the consent has been given to him, the monk who is conveying the consent reaches the Sangha, but deliberately doesn’t announce the consent, then the consent has been brought.

pli-tv-kd2:23.3.33.eng: But there is an offense of wrong conduct for the one who is conveying the consent.

pli-tv-kd2:23.3.34.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, tadahuposathe pārisuddhiṃ dentena chandampi dātuṃ, santi saṅghassa karaṇīyan”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:23.3.34.eng: On the observance day, if the Sangha has business to be done, then anyone passing on their purity should also give their consent.”

pli-tv-kd2:24.1.0.eng: 22. Discussion on being seized by relatives, etc.

pli-tv-kd2:24.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataraṃ bhikkhuṃ tadahuposathe ñātakā gaṇhiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd2:24.1.1.eng: At one time on the observance day, a certain monk was seized by his relatives.

pli-tv-kd2:24.1.3.pli: “Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuṃ tadahuposathe ñātakā gaṇhanti.
pli-tv-kd2:24.1.3.eng: “If a monk is seized by his relatives on the observance day,

pli-tv-kd2:24.1.4.eng: other monks should say to those relatives,

pli-tv-kd2:24.1.5.pli: ‘iṅgha tumhe āyasmanto imaṃ bhikkhuṃ muhuttaṃ muñcatha, yāvāyaṃ bhikkhu uposathaṃ karotī’ti.
pli-tv-kd2:24.1.5.eng: ‘Listen, please release this monk for a short time so that he can take part in the observance-day ceremony.’

pli-tv-kd2:24.2.1.eng: If they’re able to do this, it’s good.

pli-tv-kd2:24.2.2.pli: No ce labhetha, te ñātakā bhikkhūhi evamassu vacanīyā—
pli-tv-kd2:24.2.2.eng: If not, they should say to those relatives,

pli-tv-kd2:24.2.3.pli: ‘iṅgha tumhe āyasmanto muhuttaṃ ekamantaṃ hotha, yāvāyaṃ bhikkhu pārisuddhiṃ detī’ti.
pli-tv-kd2:24.2.3.eng: ‘Listen, please step aside for a moment while this monk passes on his purity.’

pli-tv-kd2:24.2.4.eng: If they’re able to do this, it’s good.

pli-tv-kd2:24.2.5.pli: No ce labhetha, te ñātakā bhikkhūhi evamassu vacanīyā—
pli-tv-kd2:24.2.5.eng: If not, they should say to those relatives,

pli-tv-kd2:24.2.6.pli: ‘iṅgha tumhe āyasmanto imaṃ bhikkhuṃ muhuttaṃ nissīmaṃ netha, yāva saṅgho uposathaṃ karotī’ti.
pli-tv-kd2:24.2.6.eng: ‘Listen, please take this monk outside the monastery zone for a short time while the Sangha does the observance-day ceremony.’

pli-tv-kd2:24.2.7.eng: If they’re able to do this, it’s good.

pli-tv-kd2:24.2.8.pli: No ce labhetha, na tveva vaggena saṅghena uposatho kātabbo.
pli-tv-kd2:24.2.8.eng: If not, you shouldn’t do the observance-day ceremony with an incomplete sangha.

pli-tv-kd2:24.2.9.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:24.3.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuṃ tadahuposathe rājāno gaṇhanti …pe…
pli-tv-kd2:24.3.1.eng: If on the observance day a monk is seized by kings,

pli-tv-kd2:24.3.4.pli: bhikkhupaccatthikā gaṇhanti, te bhikkhupaccatthikā bhikkhūhi evamassu vacanīyā—
pli-tv-kd2:24.3.4.eng: or by enemies of the monks, other monks should say to those enemies,
pli-tv-kd2:24.3.4.comm: “Enemies of monks” is a translation of bhikkhupaccatthikā. At Bu Pj 1:9.3.1, I have translated the same compound as “enemy monks”. In that rule this seems required because various people who are acting as enemies of monks are mentioned separately, such as kings, bandits, and scoundrels. Moreover, all of these are compounded with paccatthikā: bhikkhupaccatthikā, rājapaccatthikā, and so on. Since it seems reasonable to assume that all these compounds have the same structure, it follows that they should all be read as “enemies who are so-and-so” rather than “enemies of so-and-so”. This understanding is confirmed by Sp 1.58: bhikkhū eva paccatthikā bhikkhupaccatthikā, “Bhikkhupaccatthikā are just monks who are enemies.” In the present context, however, this interpretation does not seem to work. If bhikkhupaccatthikā refers to enemies who are monks, then they would have to be invited to take part in the ceremony, or some other arrangement would have to be made, but nothing is said about this in either the Pali or the commentaries. Moreover, kings, bandits, and scoundrels are in this case not compounded with paccatthikā, as they are in Bu Pj 1. I therefore conclude that the meaning here must be “enemies of monks”.

pli-tv-kd2:24.3.5.pli: ‘iṅgha tumhe āyasmanto imaṃ bhikkhuṃ muhuttaṃ muñcatha, yāvāyaṃ bhikkhu uposathaṃ karotī’ti.
pli-tv-kd2:24.3.5.eng: ‘Listen, please release this monk for a short time so that he can take part in the observance-day ceremony.’

pli-tv-kd2:24.3.6.eng: If they’re able to do this, it’s good.

pli-tv-kd2:24.3.7.pli: No ce labhetha, te bhikkhupaccatthikā bhikkhūhi evamassu vacanīyā—
pli-tv-kd2:24.3.7.eng: If not, they should say to those enemies,

pli-tv-kd2:24.3.8.pli: ‘iṅgha tumhe āyasmanto muhuttaṃ ekamantaṃ hotha, yāvāyaṃ bhikkhu pārisuddhiṃ detī’ti.
pli-tv-kd2:24.3.8.eng: ‘Listen, please step aside for a moment while this monk passes on his purity.’

pli-tv-kd2:24.3.9.eng: If they’re able to do this, it’s good.

pli-tv-kd2:24.3.10.pli: No ce labhetha, te bhikkhupaccatthikā bhikkhūhi evamassu vacanīyā—
pli-tv-kd2:24.3.10.eng: If not, they should say to those enemies,

pli-tv-kd2:24.3.11.pli: ‘iṅgha tumhe āyasmanto imaṃ bhikkhuṃ muhuttaṃ nissīmaṃ netha, yāva saṅgho uposathaṃ karotī’ti.
pli-tv-kd2:24.3.11.eng: ‘Listen, please take this monk outside the monastery zone for a short time while the Sangha does the observance-day ceremony.’

pli-tv-kd2:24.3.12.eng: If they’re able to do this, it’s good.

pli-tv-kd2:24.3.13.pli: No ce labhetha, na tveva vaggena saṅghena uposatho kātabbo.
pli-tv-kd2:24.3.13.eng: If not, you shouldn’t do the observance-day ceremony with an incomplete sangha.

pli-tv-kd2:24.3.14.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd2:25.1.1.eng: Then the Buddha addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd2:25.1.2.eng: “Gather, monks, there’s business for the Sangha.”

pli-tv-kd2:25.1.3.pli: Evaṃ vutte, aññataro bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd2:25.1.3.eng: A monk said to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd2:25.1.4.pli: “atthi, bhante, gaggo nāma bhikkhu ummattako, so anāgato”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:25.1.4.eng: “Sir, there’s a monk called Gagga who is insane. He hasn’t come.”

pli-tv-kd2:25.1.5.eng: “Monks, there are two kinds of insane monks:

pli-tv-kd2:25.1.6.pli: atthi, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ummattako saratipi uposathaṃ napi sarati, saratipi saṅghakammaṃ napi sarati, atthi neva sarati;
pli-tv-kd2:25.1.6.eng: there is the insane monk who sometimes remembers the observance day and sometimes doesn’t, who sometimes remembers the legal procedures of the Sangha and sometimes doesn’t,

pli-tv-kd2:25.1.7.pli: āgacchatipi uposathaṃ napi āgacchati, āgacchatipi saṅghakammaṃ napi āgacchati, atthi neva āgacchati.
pli-tv-kd2:25.1.7.eng: who sometimes goes to the observance-day ceremony and sometimes doesn’t, who sometimes goes to the legal procedures of the Sangha and sometimes doesn’t. Then there’s the insane monk who never remembers any of this.

pli-tv-kd2:25.2.1.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yvāyaṃ ummattako saratipi uposathaṃ napi sarati, saratipi saṅghakammaṃ napi sarati, āgacchatipi uposathaṃ napi āgacchati, āgacchatipi saṅghakammaṃ napi āgacchati, anujānāmi, bhikkhave, evarūpassa ummattakassa ummattakasammutiṃ dātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:25.2.1.eng: For the first one of these, you should make an agreement in regard to insanity.

pli-tv-kd2:25.3.1.eng: And it should be made like this.

pli-tv-kd2:25.3.2.eng: A competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd2:25.3.3.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd2:25.3.5.pli: saratipi uposathaṃ napi sarati, saratipi saṅghakammaṃ napi sarati, āgacchatipi uposathaṃ napi āgacchati, āgacchatipi saṅghakammaṃ napi āgacchati.
pli-tv-kd2:25.3.5.eng: Sometimes he remembers the observance day and sometimes he doesn’t; sometimes he remembers the legal procedures of the Sangha and sometimes he doesn’t; sometimes he goes to the observance-day ceremony and sometimes he doesn’t; sometimes he goes to the legal procedures of the Sangha and sometimes he doesn’t.

pli-tv-kd2:25.3.6.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho gaggassa bhikkhuno ummattakassa ummattakasammutiṃ dadeyya.
pli-tv-kd2:25.3.6.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should agree on the following in regard to the insanity of the monk Gagga:

pli-tv-kd2:25.3.7.pli: Sareyya vā gaggo bhikkhu uposathaṃ na vā sareyya, sareyya vā saṅghakammaṃ na vā sareyya, āgaccheyya vā uposathaṃ na vā āgaccheyya, āgaccheyya vā saṅghakammaṃ na vā āgaccheyya, saṅgho saha vā gaggena vinā vā gaggena uposathaṃ kareyya, saṅghakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd2:25.3.7.eng: whether or not Gagga remembers either the observance day or the legal procedures of the Sangha, whether or not he comes to either, the Sangha should do the observance-day ceremony, it should do the legal procedures of the Sangha, with or without Gagga.

pli-tv-kd2:25.4.1.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd2:25.4.3.pli: saratipi uposathaṃ napi sarati, saratipi saṅghakammaṃ napi sarati, āgacchatipi uposathaṃ napi āgacchati, āgacchatipi saṅghakammaṃ napi āgacchati.
pli-tv-kd2:25.4.3.eng: Sometimes he remembers the observance day and sometimes he doesn’t; sometimes he remembers the legal procedures of the Sangha and sometimes he doesn’t; sometimes he goes to the observance-day ceremony and sometimes he doesn’t; sometimes he goes to the legal procedures of the Sangha and sometimes he doesn’t.

pli-tv-kd2:25.4.4.pli: Saṅgho gaggassa bhikkhuno ummattakassa ummattakasammutiṃ deti.
pli-tv-kd2:25.4.4.eng: The Sangha agrees on the following in regard to the insanity of the monk Gagga:

pli-tv-kd2:25.4.5.pli: Sareyya vā gaggo bhikkhu uposathaṃ na vā sareyya, sareyya vā saṅghakammaṃ na vā sareyyaṃ, āgaccheyya vā uposathaṃ na vā āgaccheyya, āgaccheyya vā saṅghakammaṃ na vā āgaccheyya, saṅgho saha vā gaggena, vinā vā gaggena uposathaṃ karissati, saṅghakammaṃ karissati.
pli-tv-kd2:25.4.5.eng: whether or not Gagga remembers either the observance day or the legal procedures of the Sangha, whether or not he comes to either, the Sangha should do the observance-day ceremony, it should do the legal procedures of the Sangha, with or without Gagga.

pli-tv-kd2:25.4.6.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati gaggassa bhikkhuno ummattakassa ummattakasammutiyā dānaṃ—
pli-tv-kd2:25.4.6.eng: Any monk who approves of this agreement—

pli-tv-kd2:25.4.7.pli: sareyya vā gaggo bhikkhu uposathaṃ na vā sareyya, sareyya vā saṅghakammaṃ na vā sareyya, āgaccheyya vā uposathaṃ na vā āgaccheyya, āgaccheyya vā saṅghakammaṃ na vā āgaccheyya, saṅgho saha vā gaggena, vinā vā gaggena uposathaṃ karissati, saṅghakammaṃ karissati, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd2:25.4.7.eng: whether or not Gagga remembers either the observance day or the legal procedures of the Sangha, whether or not he comes to either, the Sangha should do the observance-day ceremony, it should do the legal procedures of the Sangha, with or without Gagga—should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd2:25.4.8.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd2:25.4.9.pli: Dinnā saṅghena gaggassa bhikkhuno ummattakassa ummattakasammuti.
pli-tv-kd2:25.4.9.eng: The Sangha has agreed on the following in regard to the insanity of the monk Gagga:

pli-tv-kd2:25.4.10.pli: Sareyya vā gaggo bhikkhu uposathaṃ na vā sareyya, sareyya vā saṅghakammaṃ na vā sareyya, āgaccheyya vā uposathaṃ na vā āgaccheyya, āgaccheyya vā saṅghakammaṃ na vā āgaccheyya, saṅgho saha vā gaggena vinā vā gaggena uposathaṃ karissati, saṅghakammaṃ karissati.
pli-tv-kd2:25.4.10.eng: whether or not Gagga remembers either the observance-day ceremony or the legal procedures of the Sangha, whether or not he comes to either, the Sangha should do the observance-day ceremony, it should do the legal procedures of the Sangha, with or without Gagga.

pli-tv-kd2:25.4.11.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:25.4.11.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-kd2:26.1.0.eng: 24. Various kinds of observance days for the Sangha, etc.

pli-tv-kd2:26.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahuposathe cattāro bhikkhū viharanti.
pli-tv-kd2:26.1.1.eng: At one time on the observance day, there were four monks staying in a certain monastery.

pli-tv-kd2:26.1.3.eng: “The Buddha has laid down a rule

pli-tv-kd2:26.1.4.pli: ‘uposatho kātabbo’ti, mayañcamhā cattāro janā, kathaṃ nu kho amhehi uposatho kātabbo”ti?
pli-tv-kd2:26.1.4.eng: that the observance-day ceremony should be done. Now there’s four of us. So how should we do the observance-day ceremony?”

pli-tv-kd2:26.1.6.eng: “When there are four of you, you should recite the Monastic Code.”

pli-tv-kd2:26.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahuposathe tayo bhikkhū viharanti.
pli-tv-kd2:26.2.1.eng: At one time on the observance day, there were three monks staying in a certain monastery.

pli-tv-kd2:26.2.3.pli: “bhagavatā anuññātaṃ catunnaṃ pātimokkhaṃ uddisituṃ, mayañcamhā tayo janā, kathaṃ nu kho amhehi uposatho kātabbo”ti?
pli-tv-kd2:26.2.3.eng: “The Buddha has instructed that the Monastic Code should be recited when there are four monks. But there’s only three of us. So how should we do the observance-day ceremony?”

pli-tv-kd2:26.2.5.eng: “When there are three of you, you should do the observance-day ceremony by declaring your purity.

pli-tv-kd2:26.3.1.eng: And you should do it like this.

pli-tv-kd2:26.3.2.pli: Byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena te bhikkhū ñāpetabbā—
pli-tv-kd2:26.3.2.eng: A competent and capable monk should inform those monks:

pli-tv-kd2:26.3.3.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask you to listen.

pli-tv-kd2:26.3.4.eng: Today is the observance day, the fifteenth.

pli-tv-kd2:26.3.5.pli: Yadāyasmantānaṃ pattakallaṃ, mayaṃ aññamaññaṃ pārisuddhiuposathaṃ kareyyāmā’ti.
pli-tv-kd2:26.3.5.eng: If the venerables are ready, we should do the observance-day ceremony by declaring purity to one another.’

pli-tv-kd2:26.3.6.pli: Therena bhikkhunā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā te bhikkhū evamassu vacanīyā—
pli-tv-kd2:26.3.6.eng: The most senior monk should arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say to the other monks:
pli-tv-kd2:26.3.6.comm: Therena bhikkhunā could be rendered “a/the senior monk”. Yet the point is that only the most senior member of the Sangha should use the semi-informal address āvuso, whereas everyone else should use the formal equivalent bhante.

pli-tv-kd2:26.3.9.eng: And he should repeat this two more times.

pli-tv-kd2:26.4.1.pli: Navakena bhikkhunā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā te bhikkhū evamassu vacanīyā—
pli-tv-kd2:26.4.1.eng: Each junior monk should arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say to the other monks:
pli-tv-kd2:26.4.1.comm: Navakena bhikkhunā could be rendered “a/the junior monk”. Yet the point here is that only the most senior member of the Sangha should use the semi-informal address āvuso, whereas everyone else should use the formal equivalent bhante. In this context, then, navaka does not have its normal meaning of “newly ordained” monk, but rather refers to any monk junior to the most senior one.

pli-tv-kd2:26.4.4.eng: And he should repeat this two more times.”

pli-tv-kd2:26.5.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahuposathe dve bhikkhū viharanti.
pli-tv-kd2:26.5.1.eng: At one time on the observance day, there were two monks staying in a certain monastery.

pli-tv-kd2:26.5.3.pli: “bhagavatā anuññātaṃ catunnaṃ pātimokkhaṃ uddisituṃ, tiṇṇannaṃ pārisuddhiuposathaṃ kātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:26.5.3.eng: “The Buddha has instructed that the Monastic Code should be recited when there are four monks and that the observance-day ceremony should be done by declaring purity when there are three.

pli-tv-kd2:26.5.4.eng: But there’s only two of us.

pli-tv-kd2:26.5.5.pli: Kathaṃ nu kho amhehi uposatho kātabbo”ti?
pli-tv-kd2:26.5.5.eng: So how should we do the observance-day ceremony?”

pli-tv-kd2:26.5.7.eng: “When there are two of you, you should do the observance-day ceremony by declaring your purity.

pli-tv-kd2:26.6.1.eng: And you should do it like this.

pli-tv-kd2:26.6.2.pli: Therena bhikkhunā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā navo bhikkhu evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd2:26.6.2.eng: The senior monk should arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say to the junior monk:

pli-tv-kd2:26.6.5.eng: And he should repeat this two more times.

pli-tv-kd2:26.7.1.pli: Navakena bhikkhunā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā thero bhikkhu evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd2:26.7.1.eng: The junior monk should arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say to the senior monk:

pli-tv-kd2:26.7.4.eng: And he should repeat this two more times.”

pli-tv-kd2:26.8.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahuposathe eko bhikkhu viharati.
pli-tv-kd2:26.8.1.eng: At one time on the observance day, a monk was staying in a certain monastery by himself.

pli-tv-kd2:26.8.3.pli: “bhagavatā anuññātaṃ catunnaṃ pātimokkhaṃ uddisituṃ, tiṇṇannaṃ pārisuddhiuposathaṃ kātuṃ, dvinnaṃ pārisuddhiuposathaṃ kātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:26.8.3.eng: “The Buddha has instructed that the Monastic Code should be recited when there are four monks and that the observance-day ceremony should be done by declaring purity when there are two or three.

pli-tv-kd2:26.8.5.pli: Kathaṃ nu kho mayā uposatho kātabbo”ti?
pli-tv-kd2:26.8.5.eng: So how should I do the observance-day ceremony?”

pli-tv-kd2:26.9.1.pli: “Idha pana, bhikkhave, aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahuposathe eko bhikkhu viharati.
pli-tv-kd2:26.9.1.eng: “On the observance day, a monk may be staying by himself in a certain monastery.

pli-tv-kd2:26.9.2.pli: Tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā yattha bhikkhū paṭikkamanti upaṭṭhānasālāya vā, maṇḍape vā, rukkhamūle vā, so deso sammajjitvā pānīyaṃ paribhojanīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpetvā āsanaṃ paññapetvā padīpaṃ katvā nisīditabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:26.9.2.eng: He should sweep the place where the monks normally go: whether the assembly hall, under a roof cover, or at the foot of a tree. He should set out water for drinking and water for washing. He should prepare a seat, light a lamp, and sit down.

pli-tv-kd2:26.9.3.pli: Sace aññe bhikkhū āgacchanti, tehi saddhiṃ uposatho kātabbo.
pli-tv-kd2:26.9.3.eng: If other monks arrive, he should do the observance-day ceremony with them.

pli-tv-kd2:26.9.4.pli: No ce āgacchanti, ajja me uposathoti adhiṭṭhātabbo.
pli-tv-kd2:26.9.4.eng: If not, he should determine: ‘Today is my observance day.’

pli-tv-kd2:26.9.5.eng: If he doesn’t make a determination, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:26.10.1.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yattha cattāro bhikkhū viharanti, na ekassa pārisuddhiṃ āharitvā tīhi pātimokkhaṃ uddisitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:26.10.1.eng: Wherever four monks are staying together, three shouldn’t recite the Monastic Code, while the purity of the fourth is brought.

pli-tv-kd2:26.10.2.eng: If you do recite the Monastic Code, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:26.10.3.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yattha tayo bhikkhū viharanti, na ekassa pārisuddhiṃ āharitvā dvīhi pārisuddhiuposatho kātabbo.
pli-tv-kd2:26.10.3.eng: Wherever three monks are staying together, two shouldn’t do the observance-day ceremony by declaring purity, while the purity of the third is brought.

pli-tv-kd2:26.10.4.eng: If you do declare purity, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:26.10.5.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yattha dve bhikkhū viharanti, na ekassa pārisuddhiṃ āharitvā ekena adhiṭṭhātabbo.
pli-tv-kd2:26.10.5.eng: Wherever two monks are staying together, one shouldn’t make a determination, while the purity of the other is brought.

pli-tv-kd2:26.10.6.eng: If you do make a determination, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd2:27.1.0.eng: 25. The process for making amends for an offense

pli-tv-kd2:27.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu tadahuposathe āpattiṃ āpanno hoti.
pli-tv-kd2:27.1.1.eng: At one time on the observance day, a certain monk committed an offense.

pli-tv-kd2:27.1.3.eng: “The Buddha has laid down a rule

pli-tv-kd2:27.1.4.eng: that one shouldn’t do the observance-day ceremony if one has an unconfessed offense.
pli-tv-kd2:27.1.4.comm: It is not clear what this refers to. It could be that it is a reference to the Pātimokkha preamble which states that “anyone who has committed an offense should reveal it” (Kd 2:3.3.3).

pli-tv-kd2:27.1.8.pli: “Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tadahuposathe āpattiṃ āpanno hoti.
pli-tv-kd2:27.1.8.eng: “On the observance day, a monk may have committed an offense.

pli-tv-kd2:27.1.9.pli: Tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā ekaṃ bhikkhuṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd2:27.1.9.eng: He should approach a single monk, arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:

pli-tv-kd2:27.1.10.pli: ‘ahaṃ, āvuso, itthannāmaṃ āpattiṃ āpanno, taṃ paṭidesemī’ti.
pli-tv-kd2:27.1.10.eng: ‘I’ve committed such-and-such an offense. I confess it.’

pli-tv-kd2:27.1.14.eng: ‘You should restrain yourself in the future.’

pli-tv-kd2:27.2.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tadahuposathe āpattiyā vematiko hoti.
pli-tv-kd2:27.2.1.eng: On the observance day, a monk may be unsure if he’s committed an offense.

pli-tv-kd2:27.2.2.pli: Tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā ekaṃ bhikkhuṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd2:27.2.2.eng: He should approach a single monk, arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:

pli-tv-kd2:27.2.3.eng: ‘I’m unsure if I’ve committed such-and-such an offense.

pli-tv-kd2:27.2.4.pli: yadā nibbematiko bhavissāmi, tadā taṃ āpattiṃ paṭikarissāmī’ti vatvā uposatho kātabbo, pātimokkhaṃ sotabbaṃ, na tveva tappaccayā uposathassa antarāyo kātabbo”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:27.2.4.eng: I’ll make amends for it when I’m sure.’ He can then take part in the observance-day ceremony and listen to the recitation of the Monastic Code. This is not an obstacle to doing the observance-day ceremony.”

pli-tv-kd2:27.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū sabhāgaṃ āpattiṃ desenti.
pli-tv-kd2:27.3.1.eng: On one occasion the monks from the group of six confessed shared offenses with one another.

pli-tv-kd2:27.3.3.eng: “You shouldn’t confess shared offenses with one another.

pli-tv-kd2:27.3.4.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd2:27.3.5.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū sabhāgaṃ āpattiṃ paṭiggaṇhanti.
pli-tv-kd2:27.3.5.eng: On one occasion the monks from the group of six received the confession of shared offenses from one another.

pli-tv-kd2:27.3.7.eng: “You shouldn’t receive the confession of shared offenses from one another.

pli-tv-kd2:27.3.8.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd2:27.4.0.eng: 26. The process for revealing an offense

pli-tv-kd2:27.4.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu pātimokkhe uddissamāne āpattiṃ sarati.
pli-tv-kd2:27.4.1.eng: At one time a certain monk remembered an offense while the Monastic Code was being recited.

pli-tv-kd2:27.4.3.eng: “The Buddha has laid down a rule

pli-tv-kd2:27.4.4.eng: that one shouldn’t do the observance-day ceremony if one has an unconfessed offense.

pli-tv-kd2:27.4.8.pli: “Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pātimokkhe uddissamāne āpattiṃ sarati.
pli-tv-kd2:27.4.8.eng: “A monk may remember an offense while the Monastic Code is being recited.

pli-tv-kd2:27.4.9.pli: Tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā sāmanto bhikkhu evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd2:27.4.9.eng: He should say to a monk sitting next to him,

pli-tv-kd2:27.4.11.pli: Ito vuṭṭhahitvā taṃ āpattiṃ paṭikarissāmī’ti vatvā uposatho kātabbo, pātimokkhaṃ sotabbaṃ, na tveva tappaccayā uposathassa antarāyo kātabbo.
pli-tv-kd2:27.4.11.eng: Once this ceremony is finished, I’ll make amends for it.’ They can then continue the observance-day ceremony and listen to the recitation of the Monastic Code. This is not an obstacle to doing the observance-day ceremony.

pli-tv-kd2:27.5.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pātimokkhe uddissamāne āpattiyā vematiko hoti.
pli-tv-kd2:27.5.1.eng: A monk may become unsure if he’s committed an offense while the Monastic Code is being recited.

pli-tv-kd2:27.5.2.pli: Tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā sāmanto bhikkhu evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd2:27.5.2.eng: He should say to a monk sitting next to him,

pli-tv-kd2:27.5.3.eng: ‘I’m unsure if I’ve committed such-and-such an offense.

pli-tv-kd2:27.5.4.pli: Yadā nibbematiko bhavissāmi, tadā taṃ āpattiṃ paṭikarissāmī’ti vatvā uposatho kātabbo, pātimokkhaṃ sotabbaṃ;
pli-tv-kd2:27.5.4.eng: I’ll make amends for it when I’m sure.’ They can then continue the observance-day ceremony and listen to the recitation of the Monastic Code.

pli-tv-kd2:27.5.5.pli: na tveva tappaccayā uposathassa antarāyo kātabbo”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:27.5.5.eng: This is not an obstacle to doing the observance-day ceremony.”

pli-tv-kd2:27.6.0.eng: 27. The process for making amends for a shared offense

pli-tv-kd2:27.6.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahuposathe sabbo saṅgho sabhāgaṃ āpattiṃ āpanno hoti.
pli-tv-kd2:27.6.1.eng: At one time on the observance day, the whole Sangha in a certain monastery had committed the same offense.

pli-tv-kd2:27.6.3.eng: “The Buddha has laid down a rule

pli-tv-kd2:27.6.4.pli: ‘na sabhāgā āpatti desetabbā, na sabhāgā āpatti paṭiggahetabbā’ti.
pli-tv-kd2:27.6.4.eng: that one shouldn’t confess or receive the confession of shared offenses.

pli-tv-kd2:27.6.5.pli: Ayañca sabbo saṅgho sabhāgaṃ āpattiṃ āpanno.
pli-tv-kd2:27.6.5.eng: Yet here the whole Sangha has committed the same offense.

pli-tv-kd2:27.6.8.pli: “Idha pana, bhikkhave, aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahuposathe sabbo saṅgho sabhāgaṃ āpattiṃ āpanno hoti.
pli-tv-kd2:27.6.8.eng: “On the observance day, the whole Sangha in a certain monastery may have committed the same offense.

pli-tv-kd2:27.6.9.pli: Tehi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi eko bhikkhu sāmantā āvāsā sajjukaṃ pāhetabbo—
pli-tv-kd2:27.6.9.eng: Those monks should straightaway send a monk to a neighboring monastery:

pli-tv-kd2:27.6.10.eng: ‘Go and make amends for this offense.

pli-tv-kd2:27.6.11.eng: When you return, we’ll make amends for it with you.’

pli-tv-kd2:27.7.1.eng: If he’s able to do this, it’s good.

pli-tv-kd2:27.7.2.pli: No ce labhetha, byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
pli-tv-kd2:27.7.2.eng: If he’s not, then a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd2:27.7.3.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd2:27.7.4.pli: Ayaṃ sabbo saṅgho sabhāgaṃ āpattiṃ āpanno.
pli-tv-kd2:27.7.4.eng: This whole Sangha has committed the same offense.

pli-tv-kd2:27.7.5.pli: Yadā aññaṃ bhikkhuṃ suddhaṃ anāpattikaṃ passissati, tadā tassa santike taṃ āpattiṃ paṭikarissatī’ti vatvā
pli-tv-kd2:27.7.5.eng: When the Sangha sees another monk who is pure and free of offenses, it should make amends for this offense with him.’

pli-tv-kd2:27.7.6.eng: Once this has been said, they can do the observance-day ceremony and listen to the recitation of the Monastic Code.

pli-tv-kd2:27.7.7.pli: na tveva tappaccayā uposathassa antarāyo kātabbo.
pli-tv-kd2:27.7.7.eng: This is not an obstacle to doing the observance-day ceremony.

pli-tv-kd2:27.8.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahuposathe sabbo saṅgho sabhāgāya āpattiyā vematiko hoti.
pli-tv-kd2:27.8.1.eng: On the observance day, the whole Sangha in a certain monastery may be unsure if it has committed the same offense.

pli-tv-kd2:27.8.2.eng: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd2:27.8.3.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd2:27.8.4.pli: Ayaṃ sabbo saṅgho sabhāgāya āpattiyā vematiko.
pli-tv-kd2:27.8.4.eng: This whole Sangha is unsure if it has committed the same offense.

pli-tv-kd2:27.8.5.pli: Yadā nibbematiko bhavissati, tadā taṃ āpattiṃ paṭikarissatī’ti
pli-tv-kd2:27.8.5.eng: When the Sangha is sure, it should make amends for this offense.’

pli-tv-kd2:27.8.6.eng: Once this has been said, they can do the observance-day ceremony and listen to the recitation of the Monastic Code.

pli-tv-kd2:27.8.7.pli: na tveva tappaccayā uposathassa antarāyo kātabbo.
pli-tv-kd2:27.8.7.eng: This is not an obstacle to doing the observance-day ceremony.

pli-tv-kd2:27.9.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, aññatarasmiṃ āvāse vassūpagato saṅgho sabhāgaṃ āpattiṃ āpanno hoti.
pli-tv-kd2:27.9.1.eng: When a sangha has entered the rainy-season residence in a certain monastery, it may happen that the whole Sangha has committed the same offense.

pli-tv-kd2:27.9.2.pli: Tehi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi eko bhikkhu sāmantā āvāsā sajjukaṃ pāhetabbo—
pli-tv-kd2:27.9.2.eng: Those monks should straightaway send a monk to a neighboring monastery:

pli-tv-kd2:27.9.3.eng: ‘Go and make amends for this offense.

pli-tv-kd2:27.9.4.pli: mayaṃ te santike taṃ āpattiṃ paṭikarissāmāti.
pli-tv-kd2:27.9.4.eng: When you return, we’ll make amends for it with you.’

pli-tv-kd2:27.9.5.eng: If he’s able to do this, it’s good.

pli-tv-kd2:27.9.6.pli: No ce labhetha, eko bhikkhu sattāhakālikaṃ pāhetabbo—
pli-tv-kd2:27.9.6.eng: If he’s not, they should send a monk under the seven-day allowance:

pli-tv-kd2:27.9.7.eng: ‘Go and make amends for this offense.

pli-tv-kd2:27.9.8.pli: mayaṃ te santike taṃ āpattiṃ paṭikarissāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:27.9.8.eng: When you return, we’ll make amends for it with you.’”

pli-tv-kd2:27.10.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarasmiṃ āvāse sabbo saṅgho sabhāgaṃ āpattiṃ āpanno hoti.
pli-tv-kd2:27.10.1.eng: Soon afterwards the whole Sangha in a certain monastery had committed the same offense.

pli-tv-kd2:27.10.2.pli: So na jānāti tassā āpattiyā nāmagottaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:27.10.2.eng: They did not know the name or the category of that offense.

pli-tv-kd2:27.10.3.pli: Tattha añño bhikkhu āgacchati bahussuto āgatāgamo dhammadharo vinayadharo mātikādharo paṇḍito byatto medhāvī lajjī kukkuccako sikkhākāmo.
pli-tv-kd2:27.10.3.eng: Then a monk arrived who was learned and a master of the tradition; who was an expert on the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Key Terms; who was knowledgeable and competent, had a sense of conscience, and was afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training.

pli-tv-kd2:27.10.4.pli: Tamenaṃ aññataro bhikkhu yena so bhikkhu tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd2:27.10.4.eng: A monk went up to him and asked,

pli-tv-kd2:27.10.5.pli: “yo nu kho, āvuso, evañcevañca karoti, kiṃ nāma so āpattiṃ āpajjatī”ti?
pli-tv-kd2:27.10.5.eng: “When someone does such-and-such, what’s the name of the offense he’s committed?”

pli-tv-kd2:27.11.2.pli: “yo kho, āvuso, evañcevañca karoti, imaṃ nāma so āpattiṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-kd2:27.11.2.eng: “When someone does such-and-such, he’s committed an offense of this name.

pli-tv-kd2:27.11.3.pli: Imaṃ nāma tvaṃ, āvuso, āpattiṃ āpanno;
pli-tv-kd2:27.11.3.eng: If you have committed this offense,

pli-tv-kd2:27.11.4.eng: you should make amends for it.”

pli-tv-kd2:27.11.6.pli: “na kho ahaṃ, āvuso, ekova imaṃ āpattiṃ āpanno;
pli-tv-kd2:27.11.6.eng: “It’s not just I alone who have committed this offense,

pli-tv-kd2:27.11.7.pli: ayaṃ sabbo saṅgho imaṃ āpattiṃ āpanno”ti.

pli-tv-kd2:27.11.9.pli: “kiṃ te, āvuso, karissati paro āpanno vā anāpanno vā.
pli-tv-kd2:27.11.9.eng: “What does it matter to you whether others have or haven’t committed an offense?

pli-tv-kd2:27.11.10.pli: Iṅgha tvaṃ, āvuso, sakāya āpattiyā vuṭṭhāhī”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:27.11.10.eng: Please clear yourself of your own offense.”

pli-tv-kd2:27.12.1.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu tassa bhikkhuno vacanena taṃ āpattiṃ paṭikaritvā yena te bhikkhū tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā te bhikkhū etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd2:27.12.1.eng: Then, because of what the learned monk had said, the other monk made amends for that offense. He then went to the other monks and said,

pli-tv-kd2:27.12.2.pli: “yo kira, āvuso, evañcevañca karoti, imaṃ nāma so āpattiṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-kd2:27.12.2.eng: “When someone does such-and-such, he’s committed an offense of this name.

pli-tv-kd2:27.12.3.pli: Imaṃ nāma tumhe, āvuso, āpattiṃ āpannā;
pli-tv-kd2:27.12.3.eng: This is the offense that you’ve committed.

pli-tv-kd2:27.12.4.eng: You should make amends for it.”

pli-tv-kd2:27.12.5.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū na icchiṃsu tassa bhikkhuno vacanena taṃ āpattiṃ paṭikātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:27.12.5.eng: But in spite of what he had said, those monks did not want to make amends for that offense.

pli-tv-kd2:27.13.1.pli: “Idha pana, bhikkhave, aññatarasmiṃ āvāse sabbo saṅgho sabhāgaṃ āpattiṃ āpanno hoti.

pli-tv-kd2:27.13.2.pli: So na jānāti tassā āpattiyā nāmagottaṃ.

pli-tv-kd2:27.13.3.pli: Tattha añño bhikkhu āgacchati bahussuto āgatāgamo dhammadharo vinayadharo mātikādharo paṇḍito byatto medhāvī lajjī kukkuccako sikkhākāmo.

pli-tv-kd2:27.13.4.pli: Tamenaṃ aññataro bhikkhu yena so bhikkhu tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ evaṃ vadeti—

pli-tv-kd2:27.13.5.pli: ‘yo nu kho, āvuso, evañcevañca karoti, kiṃ nāma so āpattiṃ āpajjatī’ti?

pli-tv-kd2:27.14.2.pli: ‘yo kho, āvuso, evañcevañca karoti, imaṃ nāma so āpattiṃ āpajjati.

pli-tv-kd2:27.14.3.pli: Imaṃ nāma tvaṃ, āvuso, āpattiṃ āpanno;

pli-tv-kd2:27.14.6.pli: ‘na kho ahaṃ, āvuso, ekova imaṃ āpattiṃ āpanno.

pli-tv-kd2:27.14.7.pli: Ayaṃ sabbo saṅgho imaṃ āpattiṃ āpanno’ti.

pli-tv-kd2:27.14.9.pli: ‘kiṃ te, āvuso, karissati paro āpanno vā anāpanno vā.

pli-tv-kd2:27.14.10.pli: Iṅgha tvaṃ, āvuso, sakāya āpattiyā vuṭṭhāhī’ti.

pli-tv-kd2:27.14.11.pli: So ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tassa bhikkhuno vacanena taṃ āpattiṃ paṭikaritvā yena te bhikkhū tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā te bhikkhū evaṃ vadeti—

pli-tv-kd2:27.14.12.pli: ‘yo kira, āvuso, evañcevañca karoti imaṃ nāma so āpattiṃ āpajjati, imaṃ nāma tumhe āvuso āpattiṃ āpannā, paṭikarotha taṃ āpattin’ti.

pli-tv-kd2:27.15.1.pli: Te ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhū tassa bhikkhuno vacanena taṃ āpattiṃ paṭikareyyuṃ, iccetaṃ kusalaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:27.15.1.eng: if those monks do make amends for that offense because of what that monk has said, then this is good.

pli-tv-kd2:27.15.2.pli: No ce paṭikareyyuṃ, na te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū tena bhikkhunā akāmā vacanīyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:27.15.2.eng: If they don’t, then that monk doesn’t need to correct them if he doesn’t want to.”

pli-tv-kd2:27.15.3.eng: The second section for recitation on the grounds for accusations is finished.

pli-tv-kd2:28.1.0.eng: 28. The group of fifteen on non-offenses

pli-tv-kd2:28.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahuposathe sambahulā āvāsikā bhikkhū sannipatiṃsu cattāro vā atirekā vā.
pli-tv-kd2:28.1.1.eng: At one time on the observance day, four or more resident monks had gathered together in a certain monastery.

pli-tv-kd2:28.1.3.eng: that there were other resident monks who had not arrived.
pli-tv-kd2:28.1.3.comm: Here “resident monk” means a monk who is within the sīmā, the monastery zone.

pli-tv-kd2:28.1.4.pli: Te dhammasaññino vinayasaññino vaggā samaggasaññino uposathaṃ akaṃsu, pātimokkhaṃ uddisiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd2:28.1.4.eng: Perceiving that they were acting according to the Teaching and the Monastic Law, perceiving that the assembly was complete although it was not, they did the observance-day ceremony and recited the Monastic Code.

pli-tv-kd2:28.1.5.pli: Tehi uddissamāne pātimokkhe, athaññe āvāsikā bhikkhū āgacchiṃsu bahutarā.
pli-tv-kd2:28.1.5.eng: While they were doing it, a greater number of resident monks arrived.

pli-tv-kd2:28.2.1.pli: “Idha pana, bhikkhave, aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahuposathe sambahulā āvāsikā bhikkhū sannipatanti cattāro vā atirekā vā.
pli-tv-kd2:28.2.1.eng: “On the observance day, four or more resident monks may have gathered together in a certain monastery.

pli-tv-kd2:28.2.3.eng: there are other resident monks who haven’t arrived.

pli-tv-kd2:28.2.4.pli: Te dhammasaññino vinayasaññino vaggā samaggasaññino uposathaṃ karonti, pātimokkhaṃ uddisanti.
pli-tv-kd2:28.2.4.eng: Perceiving that they’re acting according to the Teaching and the Monastic Law, perceiving that the assembly is complete although it’s not, they do the observance-day ceremony and recite the Monastic Code.

pli-tv-kd2:28.2.5.pli: Tehi uddissamāne pātimokkhe, athaññe āvāsikā bhikkhū āgacchanti bahutarā.
pli-tv-kd2:28.2.5.eng: While they’re doing it, a greater number of resident monks arrive.

pli-tv-kd2:28.2.6.pli: Tehi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi puna pātimokkhaṃ uddisitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:28.2.6.eng: In such a case, those monks should recite the Monastic Code once more.

pli-tv-kd2:28.2.7.eng: There’s no offense for the reciters.

pli-tv-kd2:28.3.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahuposathe sambahulā āvāsikā bhikkhū sannipatanti cattāro vā atirekā vā.
pli-tv-kd2:28.3.1.eng: On the observance day, four or more resident monks may have gathered together in a certain monastery.

pli-tv-kd2:28.3.3.eng: there are other resident monks who haven’t arrived.

pli-tv-kd2:28.3.4.pli: Te dhammasaññino vinayasaññino vaggā samaggasaññino uposathaṃ karonti, pātimokkhaṃ uddisanti.
pli-tv-kd2:28.3.4.eng: Perceiving that they’re acting according to the Teaching and the Monastic Law, perceiving that the assembly is complete although it’s not, they do the observance-day ceremony and recite the Monastic Code.

pli-tv-kd2:28.3.5.pli: Tehi uddissamāne pātimokkhe, athaññe āvāsikā bhikkhū āgacchanti samasamā.
pli-tv-kd2:28.3.5.eng: While they’re doing it, an equal number of resident monks arrive.

pli-tv-kd2:28.3.6.eng: In such a case, what has been recited is valid, and the remainder should be listened to.

pli-tv-kd2:28.3.7.eng: There’s no offense for the reciters.

pli-tv-kd2:28.3.8.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahuposathe sambahulā āvāsikā bhikkhū sannipatanti cattāro vā atirekā vā.
pli-tv-kd2:28.3.8.eng: On the observance day, four or more resident monks may have gathered together in a certain monastery.

pli-tv-kd2:28.3.10.eng: there are other resident monks who haven’t arrived.

pli-tv-kd2:28.3.11.pli: Te dhammasaññino vinayasaññino vaggā samaggasaññino uposathaṃ karonti pātimokkhaṃ uddisanti.
pli-tv-kd2:28.3.11.eng: Perceiving that they’re acting according to the Teaching and the Monastic Law, perceiving that the assembly is complete although it’s not, they do the observance-day ceremony and recite the Monastic Code.

pli-tv-kd2:28.3.12.pli: Tehi uddissamāne pātimokkhe, athaññe āvāsikā bhikkhū āgacchanti thokatarā.
pli-tv-kd2:28.3.12.eng: While they’re doing it, a smaller number of resident monks arrive.

pli-tv-kd2:28.3.13.eng: In such a case, what has been recited is valid, and the remainder should be listened to.

pli-tv-kd2:28.3.14.eng: There’s no offense for the reciters.

pli-tv-kd2:28.4.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahuposathe sambahulā āvāsikā bhikkhū sannipatanti cattāro vā atirekā vā.
pli-tv-kd2:28.4.1.eng: On the observance day, four or more resident monks may have gathered together in a certain monastery.

pli-tv-kd2:28.4.3.eng: there are other resident monks who haven’t arrived.

pli-tv-kd2:28.4.4.pli: Te dhammasaññino vinayasaññino vaggā samaggasaññino uposathaṃ karonti pātimokkhaṃ uddisanti.
pli-tv-kd2:28.4.4.eng: Perceiving that they’re acting according to the Teaching and the Monastic Law, perceiving that the assembly is complete although it’s not, they do the observance-day ceremony and recite the Monastic Code.

pli-tv-kd2:28.4.5.pli: Tehi uddiṭṭhamatte pātimokkhe, athaññe āvāsikā bhikkhū āgacchanti bahutarā.
pli-tv-kd2:28.4.5.eng: When they’ve just finished, a greater number of resident monks arrive.

pli-tv-kd2:28.4.6.pli: Tehi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi puna pātimokkhaṃ uddisitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:28.4.6.eng: In such a case, those monks should recite the Monastic Code once more.

pli-tv-kd2:28.4.7.eng: There’s no offense for the reciters.

pli-tv-kd2:28.4.8.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahuposathe sambahulā āvāsikā bhikkhū sannipatanti cattāro vā atirekā vā.
pli-tv-kd2:28.4.8.eng: On the observance day, four or more resident monks may have gathered together in a certain monastery.

pli-tv-kd2:28.4.10.eng: there are other resident monks who haven’t arrived.

pli-tv-kd2:28.4.11.pli: Te dhammasaññino vinayasaññino vaggā samaggasaññino uposathaṃ karonti pātimokkhaṃ uddisanti.
pli-tv-kd2:28.4.11.eng: Perceiving that they’re acting according to the Teaching and the Monastic Law, perceiving that the assembly is complete although it’s not, they do the observance-day ceremony and recite the Monastic Code.

pli-tv-kd2:28.4.12.pli: Tehi uddiṭṭhamatte pātimokkhe, athaññe āvāsikā bhikkhū āgacchanti samasamā.
pli-tv-kd2:28.4.12.eng: When they’ve just finished, an equal number of resident monks arrive.

pli-tv-kd2:28.4.13.pli: Uddiṭṭhaṃ suuddiṭṭhaṃ, tesaṃ santike pārisuddhi ārocetabbā.
pli-tv-kd2:28.4.13.eng: In such a case, what has been recited is valid, and the late arrivals should announce their purity in the presence of the others.

pli-tv-kd2:28.4.14.eng: There’s no offense for the reciters.

pli-tv-kd2:28.4.15.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahuposathe sambahulā āvāsikā bhikkhū sannipatanti cattāro vā atirekā vā.
pli-tv-kd2:28.4.15.eng: On the observance day, four or more resident monks may have gathered together in a certain monastery.

pli-tv-kd2:28.4.17.eng: there are other resident monks who haven’t arrived.

pli-tv-kd2:28.4.18.pli: Te dhammasaññino vinayasaññino vaggā samaggasaññino uposathaṃ karonti pātimokkhaṃ uddisanti.
pli-tv-kd2:28.4.18.eng: Perceiving that they’re acting according to the Teaching and the Monastic Law, perceiving that the assembly is complete although it’s not, they do the observance-day ceremony and recite the Monastic Code.

pli-tv-kd2:28.4.19.pli: Tehi uddiṭṭhamatte pātimokkhe, athaññe āvāsikā bhikkhū āgacchanti thokatarā.
pli-tv-kd2:28.4.19.eng: When they’ve just finished, a smaller number of resident monks arrive.

pli-tv-kd2:28.4.20.pli: Uddiṭṭhaṃ suuddiṭṭhaṃ, tesaṃ santike pārisuddhi ārocetabbā.
pli-tv-kd2:28.4.20.eng: In such a case, what has been recited is valid, and the late arrivals should announce their purity in the presence of the others.

pli-tv-kd2:28.4.21.eng: There’s no offense for the reciters.

pli-tv-kd2:28.5.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahuposathe sambahulā āvāsikā bhikkhū sannipatanti cattāro vā atirekā vā.
pli-tv-kd2:28.5.1.eng: On the observance day, four or more resident monks may have gathered together in a certain monastery.

pli-tv-kd2:28.5.3.eng: there are other resident monks who haven’t arrived.

pli-tv-kd2:28.5.4.pli: Te dhammasaññino vinayasaññino vaggā samaggasaññino uposathaṃ karonti pātimokkhaṃ uddisanti.
pli-tv-kd2:28.5.4.eng: Perceiving that they’re acting according to the Teaching and the Monastic Law, perceiving that the assembly is complete although it’s not, they do the observance-day ceremony and recite the Monastic Code.

pli-tv-kd2:28.5.5.pli: Tehi uddiṭṭhamatte pātimokkhe, avuṭṭhitāya parisāya, athaññe āvāsikā bhikkhū āgacchanti bahutarā.
pli-tv-kd2:28.5.5.eng: When they’ve just finished, and none of the gathering has left, a greater number of resident monks arrive.
pli-tv-kd2:28.5.5.comm: Avuṭṭhitāya parisāya literally means that “the gathering has not got up”. The point, presumably, is that the meeting is not yet over and those present have not started to leave.

pli-tv-kd2:28.5.6.pli: Tehi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi puna pātimokkhaṃ uddisitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:28.5.6.eng: In such a case, those monks should recite the Monastic Code once more.

pli-tv-kd2:28.5.7.eng: There’s no offense for the reciters.

pli-tv-kd2:28.5.8.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahuposathe sambahulā āvāsikā bhikkhū sannipatanti cattāro vā atirekā vā.
pli-tv-kd2:28.5.8.eng: On the observance day, four or more resident monks may have gathered together in a certain monastery.

pli-tv-kd2:28.5.10.eng: there are other resident monks who haven’t arrived.

pli-tv-kd2:28.5.11.pli: Te dhammasaññino vinayasaññino vaggā samaggasaññino uposathaṃ karonti pātimokkhaṃ uddisanti.
pli-tv-kd2:28.5.11.eng: Perceiving that they’re acting according to the Teaching and the Monastic Law, perceiving that the assembly is complete although it’s not, they do the observance-day ceremony and recite the Monastic Code.

pli-tv-kd2:28.5.12.pli: Tehi uddiṭṭhamatte pātimokkhe, avuṭṭhitāya parisāya, athaññe āvāsikā bhikkhū āgacchanti samasamā.
pli-tv-kd2:28.5.12.eng: When they’ve just finished, and none of the gathering has left, an equal number of resident monks arrive.

pli-tv-kd2:28.5.13.pli: Uddiṭṭhaṃ suuddiṭṭhaṃ, tesaṃ santike pārisuddhi ārocetabbā.
pli-tv-kd2:28.5.13.eng: In such a case, what has been recited is valid, and the late arrivals should announce their purity in the presence of the others.

pli-tv-kd2:28.5.14.eng: There’s no offense for the reciters.

pli-tv-kd2:31.1.1.eng: “On the observance day, four or more resident monks may have gathered together in a certain monastery.

pli-tv-kd2:31.1.3.eng: there are other resident monks who haven’t arrived.

pli-tv-kd2:31.1.4.pli: Te ‘kappateva amhākaṃ uposatho kātuṃ nāmhākaṃ na kappatī’ti—
pli-tv-kd2:31.1.4.eng: They think, ‘It’s allowable for us to do the observance-day ceremony; it’s not unallowable.’

pli-tv-kd2:31.1.5.eng: Being anxious, they do the observance-day ceremony and recite the Monastic Code.

pli-tv-kd2:31.1.6.pli: Tehi uddissamāne pātimokkhe, athaññe āvāsikā bhikkhū āgacchanti bahutarā.
pli-tv-kd2:31.1.6.eng: While they’re doing it, a greater number of resident monks arrive.

pli-tv-kd2:31.1.7.pli: Tehi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi puna pātimokkhaṃ uddisitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:31.1.7.eng: In such a case, those monks should recite the Monastic Code once more.

pli-tv-kd2:31.1.8.eng: There’s an offense of wrong conduct for the reciters.

pli-tv-kd2:31.2.3.eng: there are other resident monks who haven’t arrived.

pli-tv-kd2:31.2.4.eng: They think, ‘It’s allowable for us to do the observance-day ceremony; it’s not unallowable.’

pli-tv-kd2:31.2.5.eng: Being anxious, they do the observance-day ceremony and recite the Monastic Code.

pli-tv-kd2:31.2.6.pli: Tehi uddissamāne pātimokkhe, athaññe āvāsikā bhikkhū āgacchanti samasamā.
pli-tv-kd2:31.2.6.eng: While they’re doing it, an equal number of resident monks arrive.

pli-tv-kd2:31.2.7.eng: In such a case, what has been recited is valid, and the remainder should be listened to.

pli-tv-kd2:31.2.8.eng: There’s an offense of wrong conduct for the reciters.

pli-tv-kd2:31.2.9.eng: On the observance day, four or more resident monks may have gathered together in a certain monastery.

pli-tv-kd2:31.2.11.eng: there are other resident monks who haven’t arrived.

pli-tv-kd2:31.2.12.pli: Te ‘kappateva amhākaṃ uposatho kātuṃ, nāmhākaṃ na kappatī’ti—
pli-tv-kd2:31.2.12.eng: They think, ‘It’s allowable for us to do the observance-day ceremony; it’s not unallowable.’

pli-tv-kd2:31.2.13.eng: Being anxious, they do the observance-day ceremony and recite the Monastic Code.

pli-tv-kd2:31.2.14.pli: Tehi uddissamāne pātimokkhe, athaññe āvāsikā bhikkhū āgacchanti thokatarā.
pli-tv-kd2:31.2.14.eng: While they’re doing it, a smaller number of resident monks arrive.

pli-tv-kd2:31.2.15.eng: In such a case, what has been recited is valid, and the remainder should be listened to.

pli-tv-kd2:31.2.16.eng: There’s an offense of wrong conduct for the reciters.

pli-tv-kd2:31.2.17.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahuposathe sambahulā āvāsikā bhikkhū sannipatanti cattāro vā atirekā vā.
pli-tv-kd2:31.2.17.eng: On the observance day, four or more resident monks may have gathered together in a certain monastery.

pli-tv-kd2:31.2.19.eng: there are other resident monks who haven’t arrived.

pli-tv-kd2:31.2.20.pli: Te ‘kappateva amhākaṃ uposatho kātuṃ nāmhākaṃ na kappatī’ti—
pli-tv-kd2:31.2.20.eng: They think, ‘It’s allowable for us to do the observance-day ceremony; it’s not unallowable.’

pli-tv-kd2:31.2.21.eng: Being anxious, they do the observance-day ceremony and recite the Monastic Code.

pli-tv-kd2:31.2.23.eng: When they’ve just finished, and none of the gathering has left …

pli-tv-kd2:31.2.24.eng: When they’ve just finished, and only some members of the gathering have left …

pli-tv-kd2:31.2.25.pli: sabbāya vuṭṭhitāya parisāya, athaññe āvāsikā bhikkhū āgacchanti bahutarā …pe…
pli-tv-kd2:31.2.25.eng: When they’ve just finished, and the entire gathering has left, a greater number of resident monks arrive …

pli-tv-kd2:31.2.26.eng: an equal number of resident monks arrive …

pli-tv-kd2:31.2.27.eng: a smaller number of resident monks arrive.

pli-tv-kd2:31.2.28.pli: Uddiṭṭhaṃ suuddiṭṭhaṃ, tesaṃ santike pārisuddhi ārocetabbā.
pli-tv-kd2:31.2.28.eng: In such a case, what has been recited is valid, and the late arrivals should announce their purity in the presence of the others.

pli-tv-kd2:31.2.29.eng: There’s an offense of wrong conduct for the reciters.”

pli-tv-kd2:31.2.30.eng: The group of fifteen on being anxious is finished.

pli-tv-kd2:32.1.0.eng: 32. The group of fifteen on aiming at schism

pli-tv-kd2:32.1.3.eng: there are other resident monks who haven’t arrived.

pli-tv-kd2:32.1.4.eng: They think, ‘May they get lost! May they disappear! We are better off without them.’

pli-tv-kd2:32.1.5.eng: They then do the observance-day ceremony and recite the Monastic Code, aiming at schism.

pli-tv-kd2:32.1.8.eng: And there’s a serious offense for the reciters.

pli-tv-kd2:32.2.22.eng: When they’ve just finished, a greater number of resident monks arrive.

pli-tv-kd2:32.2.23.eng: In such a case, those monks should recite the Monastic Code once more.

pli-tv-kd2:32.2.25.eng: On the observance day, four or more resident monks may have gathered together in a certain monastery.

pli-tv-kd2:32.2.26.eng: They know there are other resident monks who haven’t arrived.

pli-tv-kd2:32.2.27.pli: Te ‘nassantete, vinassantete, ko tehi attho’ti bhedapurekkhārā uposathaṃ karonti, pātimokkhaṃ uddisanti.
