pli-tv-kd2:32.2.92.eng: When they’ve just finished, and the entire gathering has left, a greater number of resident monks arrive.

pli-tv-kd2:32.2.93.pli: Tehi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi puna pātimokkhaṃ uddisitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:32.2.93.eng: In such a case, those monks should recite the Monastic Code once more.

pli-tv-kd2:32.2.94.eng: And there’s a serious offense for the reciters.

pli-tv-kd2:32.2.95.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahuposathe sambahulā āvāsikā bhikkhū sannipatanti cattāro vā atirekā vā.
pli-tv-kd2:32.2.95.eng: On the observance day, four or more resident monks may have gathered together in a certain monastery.

pli-tv-kd2:32.2.97.eng: there are other resident monks who haven’t arrived.

pli-tv-kd2:32.2.98.eng: They think, ‘May they get lost! May they disappear! We are better off without them.’

pli-tv-kd2:32.2.99.eng: They then do the observance-day ceremony and recite the Monastic Code, aiming at schism.

pli-tv-kd2:32.2.100.pli: Tehi uddiṭṭhamatte pātimokkhe, sabbāya vuṭṭhitāya parisāya, athaññe āvāsikā bhikkhū āgacchanti samasamā.
pli-tv-kd2:32.2.100.eng: When they’ve just finished, and the entire gathering has left, an equal number of resident monks arrive.

pli-tv-kd2:32.2.101.pli: Uddiṭṭhaṃ suuddiṭṭhaṃ, tesaṃ santike pārisuddhi ārocetabbā.
pli-tv-kd2:32.2.101.eng: In such a case, what has been recited is valid, and the late arrivals should announce their purity in the presence of the others.

pli-tv-kd2:32.2.102.eng: And there’s a serious offense for the reciters.

pli-tv-kd2:32.2.103.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahuposathe sambahulā āvāsikā bhikkhū sannipatanti cattāro vā atirekā vā.
pli-tv-kd2:32.2.103.eng: On the observance day, four or more resident monks may have gathered together in a certain monastery.

pli-tv-kd2:32.2.105.eng: there are other resident monks who haven’t arrived.

pli-tv-kd2:32.2.106.eng: They think, ‘May they get lost! May they disappear! We are better off without them.’

pli-tv-kd2:32.2.107.eng: They then do the observance-day ceremony and recite the Monastic Code, aiming at schism.

pli-tv-kd2:32.2.108.pli: Tehi uddiṭṭhamatte pātimokkhe, sabbāya vuṭṭhitāya parisāya, athaññe āvāsikā bhikkhū āgacchanti thokatarā.
pli-tv-kd2:32.2.108.eng: When they’ve just finished, and the entire gathering has left, a smaller number of resident monks arrive.

pli-tv-kd2:32.2.109.pli: Uddiṭṭhaṃ suuddiṭṭhaṃ, tesaṃ santike pārisuddhi ārocetabbā.
pli-tv-kd2:32.2.109.eng: In such a case, what has been recited is valid, and the late arrivals should announce their purity in the presence of the others.

pli-tv-kd2:32.2.110.eng: And there’s a serious offense for the reciters.”

pli-tv-kd2:32.2.111.eng: The group of fifteen on aiming at schism is finished. The group of seventy-five is finished.

pli-tv-kd2:33.1.0.eng: 33. The successive series on entering a monastery zone

pli-tv-kd2:33.1.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahuposathe sambahulā āvāsikā bhikkhū sannipatanti cattāro vā atirekā vā.
pli-tv-kd2:33.1.1.eng: “On the observance day, four or more resident monks may have gathered together in a certain monastery.

pli-tv-kd2:33.1.3.eng: that other resident monks are entering the monastery zone. …

pli-tv-kd2:33.1.5.eng: that other resident monks have entered the monastery zone. …

pli-tv-kd2:33.1.6.pli: te na passanti aññe āvāsike bhikkhū antosīmaṃ okkamante …pe…
pli-tv-kd2:33.1.6.eng: They don’t see that other resident monks are entering the monastery zone. …

pli-tv-kd2:33.1.7.pli: te na passanti aññe āvāsike bhikkhū antosīmaṃ okkante …pe…
pli-tv-kd2:33.1.7.eng: They don’t see that other resident monks have entered the monastery zone. …

pli-tv-kd2:33.1.9.eng: that other resident monks are entering the monastery zone. …

pli-tv-kd2:33.1.11.eng: that other resident monks have entered the monastery zone. …”

pli-tv-kd2:33.1.12.pli: Āvāsikena āvāsikā ekasatapañcasattati tikanayato, āvāsikena āgantukā, āgantukena āvāsikā, āgantukena āgantukā peyyālamukhena satta tikasatāni honti.
pli-tv-kd2:33.1.12.eng: As there are one hundred and seventy-five sets of three for resident monks with resident monks, so there are for newly-arrived monks with resident monks, resident monks with newly-arrived monks, newly-arrived monks with newly-arrived monks. Thus by way of succession, there are seven hundred sets of three.

pli-tv-kd2:34.1.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, āvāsikānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ cātuddaso hoti, āgantukānaṃ pannaraso.
pli-tv-kd2:34.1.1.eng: “It may be, monks, that for the resident monks it’s the fourteenth day of the lunar half-month, but for the newly-arrived monks it’s the fifteenth. Then—

pli-tv-kd2:34.1.2.pli: Sace āvāsikā bahutarā honti, āgantukehi āvāsikānaṃ anuvattitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:34.1.2.eng: If the number of resident monks is greater, the newly-arrived monks should fall in line with the resident monks.

pli-tv-kd2:34.1.3.pli: Sace samasamā honti, āgantukehi āvāsikānaṃ anuvattitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:34.1.3.eng: If the number is the same, the newly-arrived monks should fall in line with the resident monks.

pli-tv-kd2:34.1.4.pli: Sace āgantukā bahutarā honti, āvāsikehi āgantukānaṃ anuvattitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:34.1.4.eng: If the number of newly-arrived monks is greater, the resident monks should fall in line with the newly-arrived monks.

pli-tv-kd2:34.2.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, āvāsikānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pannaraso hoti, āgantukānaṃ cātuddaso.
pli-tv-kd2:34.2.1.eng: It may be that for the resident monks it’s the fifteenth day of the lunar half-month, but for the newly-arrived monks it’s the fourteenth. Then—

pli-tv-kd2:34.2.2.pli: Sace āvāsikā bahutarā honti, āgantukehi āvāsikānaṃ anuvattitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:34.2.2.eng: If the number of resident monks is greater, the newly-arrived monks should fall in line with the resident monks.

pli-tv-kd2:34.2.3.pli: Sace samasamā honti, āgantukehi āvāsikānaṃ anuvattitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:34.2.3.eng: If the number is the same, the newly-arrived monks should fall in line with the resident monks.

pli-tv-kd2:34.2.4.pli: Sace āgantukā bahutarā honti, āvāsikehi āgantukānaṃ anuvattitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:34.2.4.eng: If the number of newly-arrived monks is greater, the resident monks should fall in line with the newly-arrived monks.

pli-tv-kd2:34.3.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, āvāsikānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pāṭipado hoti, āgantukānaṃ pannaraso.
pli-tv-kd2:34.3.1.eng: It may be that for the resident monks it’s the day after the observance day, but for the newly-arrived monks it’s the fifteenth day of the lunar half-month. Then—

pli-tv-kd2:34.3.2.pli: Sace āvāsikā bahutarā honti, āvāsikehi āgantukānaṃ nākāmā dātabbā sāmaggī.
pli-tv-kd2:34.3.2.eng: If the number of resident monks is greater, the resident monks may, if they’re willing, do the observance-day ceremony with the newly-arrived monks.

pli-tv-kd2:34.3.3.eng: Otherwise the newly-arrived monks should go outside the monastery zone and do the observance-day ceremony there.

pli-tv-kd2:34.3.4.pli: Sace samasamā honti, āvāsikehi āgantukānaṃ nākāmā dātabbā sāmaggī.
pli-tv-kd2:34.3.4.eng: If the number is the same, the resident monks may, if they’re willing, do the observance-day ceremony with the newly-arrived monks.

pli-tv-kd2:34.3.5.eng: Otherwise the newly-arrived monks should go outside the monastery zone and do the observance-day ceremony there.

pli-tv-kd2:34.3.6.pli: Sace āgantukā bahutarā honti, āvāsikehi āgantukānaṃ sāmaggī vā dātabbā nissīmaṃ vā gantabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:34.3.6.eng: If the number of newly-arrived monks is greater, the resident monks should do the observance-day ceremony with the newly-arrived monks, or they should go outside the monastery zone while the newly-arrived monks do the observance-day ceremony.

pli-tv-kd2:34.4.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, āvāsikānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pannaraso hoti, āgantukānaṃ pāṭipado.
pli-tv-kd2:34.4.1.eng: It may be that for the resident monks it’s the fifteenth day of the lunar half-month, but for the newly-arrived monks it’s the day after the observance day. Then—

pli-tv-kd2:34.4.2.pli: Sace āvāsikā bahutarā honti, āgantukehi āvāsikānaṃ sāmaggī vā dātabbā nissīmaṃ vā gantabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:34.4.2.eng: If the number of resident monks is greater, the newly-arrived monks should do the observance-day ceremony with the resident monks, or they should go outside the monastery zone while the resident monks do the observance-day ceremony.

pli-tv-kd2:34.4.3.pli: Sace samasamā honti, āgantukehi āvāsikānaṃ sāmaggī vā dātabbā nissīmaṃ vā gantabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:34.4.3.eng: If the number is the same, the newly-arrived monks should do the observance-day ceremony with the resident monks, or they should go outside the monastery zone while the resident monks do the observance-day ceremony.

pli-tv-kd2:34.4.4.pli: Sace āgantukā bahutarā honti, āgantukehi āvāsikānaṃ nākāmā dātabbā sāmaggī.
pli-tv-kd2:34.4.4.eng: If the number of newly-arrived monks is greater, they may, if they’re willing, do the observance-day ceremony with the resident monks.

pli-tv-kd2:34.4.5.eng: Otherwise the resident monks should go outside the monastery zone and do the observance-day ceremony there.”

pli-tv-kd2:34.5.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, āgantukā bhikkhū passanti āvāsikānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ āvāsikākāraṃ, āvāsikaliṅgaṃ, āvāsikanimittaṃ, āvāsikuddesaṃ, supaññattaṃ mañcapīṭhaṃ, bhisibibbohanaṃ, pānīyaṃ paribhojanīyaṃ sūpaṭṭhitaṃ, pariveṇaṃ susammaṭṭhaṃ;
pli-tv-kd2:34.5.1.eng: “It may happen that newly-arrived monks see signs and indications of resident monks: beds and benches that are made up, water for drinking and water for washing that are ready for use, yards that are well swept.

pli-tv-kd2:34.5.2.pli: passitvā vematikā honti—‘atthi nu kho āvāsikā bhikkhū natthi nu kho’ti.
pli-tv-kd2:34.5.2.eng: As a consequence, they’re unsure whether or not there are resident monks there. Then—

pli-tv-kd2:34.6.2.eng: If they do the observance-day ceremony without investigating,

pli-tv-kd2:34.6.3.eng: there’s an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:34.6.6.eng: and then do the observance-day ceremony,

pli-tv-kd2:34.6.10.eng: and then do the observance-day ceremony together,

pli-tv-kd2:34.6.14.eng: but then do the observance-day ceremony separately,

pli-tv-kd2:34.6.15.eng: there’s an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:34.6.19.eng: ‘May they get lost! May they disappear! We are better off without them,’

pli-tv-kd2:34.6.20.eng: and then do the observance-day ceremony aiming at schism,

pli-tv-kd2:34.7.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, āgantukā bhikkhū suṇanti āvāsikānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ āvāsikākāraṃ, āvāsikaliṅgaṃ, āvāsikanimittaṃ, āvāsikuddesaṃ, caṅkamantānaṃ padasaddaṃ, sajjhāyasaddaṃ, ukkāsitasaddaṃ, khipitasaddaṃ;
pli-tv-kd2:34.7.1.eng: It may happen that newly-arrived monks hear signs and indications of resident monks: the sound of the feet of someone doing walking meditation, the sound of recitation, the sound of coughing, the sound of sneezing.

pli-tv-kd2:34.7.2.pli: sutvā vematikā honti—‘atthi nu kho āvāsikā bhikkhū natthi nu kho’ti.
pli-tv-kd2:34.7.2.eng: As a consequence, they’re unsure whether or not there are resident monks there. Then—

pli-tv-kd2:34.7.3.pli: Te vematikā na vicinanti; avicinitvā uposathaṃ karonti. Āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-kd2:34.7.3.eng: If they do the observance-day ceremony without investigating, there’s an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:34.7.4.pli: Te vematikā vicinanti; vicinitvā na passanti; apassitvā uposathaṃ karonti. Anāpatti.
pli-tv-kd2:34.7.4.eng: If they investigate, but don’t see anyone, and then do the observance-day ceremony, there’s no offense.

pli-tv-kd2:34.7.5.pli: Te vematikā vicinanti; vicinitvā passanti; passitvā ekato uposathaṃ karonti. Anāpatti.
pli-tv-kd2:34.7.5.eng: If they investigate, and they see someone, and then do the observance-day ceremony together, there’s no offense.

pli-tv-kd2:34.7.6.pli: Te vematikā vicinanti; vicinitvā passanti; passitvā pāṭekkaṃ uposathaṃ karonti. Āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-kd2:34.7.6.eng: If they investigate, and they see someone, but then do the observance-day ceremony separately, there’s an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:34.7.7.pli: Te vematikā vicinanti; vicinitvā passanti; passitvā—‘nassantete, vinassantete, ko tehi attho’ti—bhedapurekkhārā uposathaṃ karonti. Āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-kd2:34.7.7.eng: If they investigate, and they see someone, but think, ‘May they get lost! May they disappear! We are better off without them,’ and then do the observance-day ceremony aiming at schism, there’s a serious offense.

pli-tv-kd2:34.8.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, āvāsikā bhikkhū passanti āgantukānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ āgantukākāraṃ, āgantukaliṅgaṃ, āgantukanimittaṃ, āgantukuddesaṃ, aññātakaṃ pattaṃ, aññātakaṃ cīvaraṃ, aññātakaṃ nisīdanaṃ, pādānaṃ dhotaṃ, udakanissekaṃ;
pli-tv-kd2:34.8.1.eng: It may happen that resident monks see signs and indications of newly-arrived monks: an unknown almsbowl, an unknown robe, an unknown sitting mat, water poured on the ground from the washing of feet.

pli-tv-kd2:34.8.2.pli: passitvā vematikā honti—‘atthi nu kho āgantukā bhikkhū natthi nu kho’ti.
pli-tv-kd2:34.8.2.eng: As a consequence, they’re unsure whether or not monks have arrived. Then—

pli-tv-kd2:34.8.3.pli: Te vematikā na vicinanti; avicinitvā uposathaṃ karonti. Āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-kd2:34.8.3.eng: If they do the observance-day ceremony without investigating, there’s an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:34.8.4.pli: Te vematikā vicinanti; vicinitvā na passanti; apassitvā uposathaṃ karonti. Anāpatti.
pli-tv-kd2:34.8.4.eng: If they investigate, but don’t see anyone, and then do the observance-day ceremony, there’s no offense.

pli-tv-kd2:34.8.5.pli: Te vematikā vicinanti; vicinitvā passanti; passitvā ekato uposathaṃ karonti. Anāpatti.
pli-tv-kd2:34.8.5.eng: If they investigate, and they see someone, and then do the observance-day ceremony together, there’s no offense.

pli-tv-kd2:34.8.6.pli: Te vematikā vicinanti; vicinitvā passanti; passitvā pāṭekkaṃ uposathaṃ karonti. Āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-kd2:34.8.6.eng: If they investigate, and they see someone, but then do the observance-day ceremony separately, there’s an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:34.8.7.pli: Te vematikā vicinanti; vicinitvā passanti; passitvā—‘nassantete, vinassantete, ko tehi attho’ti—bhedapurekkhārā uposathaṃ karonti. Āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-kd2:34.8.7.eng: If they investigate, and they see someone, but think, ‘May they get lost! May they disappear! We are better off without them,’ and then do the observance-day ceremony aiming at schism, there’s a serious offense.

pli-tv-kd2:34.9.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, āvāsikā bhikkhū suṇanti āgantukānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ āgantukākāraṃ, āgantukaliṅgaṃ, āgantukanimittaṃ, āgantukuddesaṃ, āgacchantānaṃ padasaddaṃ, upāhanapapphoṭanasaddaṃ, ukkāsitasaddaṃ, khipitasaddaṃ;
pli-tv-kd2:34.9.1.eng: It may happen that resident monks hear signs and indications of newly-arrived monks: the sound of the feet of someone arriving, the sound of sandals being knocked together, the sound of coughing, the sound of sneezing.

pli-tv-kd2:34.9.2.pli: sutvā vematikā honti—‘atthi nu kho āgantukā bhikkhū natthi nu kho’ti.
pli-tv-kd2:34.9.2.eng: As a consequence, they’re unsure whether or not monks have arrived. Then—

pli-tv-kd2:34.9.3.pli: Te vematikā na vicinanti; avicinitvā uposathaṃ karonti. Āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-kd2:34.9.3.eng: If they do the observance-day ceremony without investigating, there’s an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:34.9.4.pli: Te vematikā vicinanti; vicinitvā na passanti; apassitvā uposathaṃ karonti. Anāpatti.
pli-tv-kd2:34.9.4.eng: If they investigate, but don’t see anyone, and then do the observance-day ceremony, there’s no offense.

pli-tv-kd2:34.9.5.pli: Te vematikā vicinanti; vicinitvā passanti; passitvā ekato uposathaṃ karonti. Anāpatti.
pli-tv-kd2:34.9.5.eng: If they investigate, and they see someone, and then do the observance-day ceremony together, there’s no offense.

pli-tv-kd2:34.9.6.pli: Te vematikā vicinanti; vicinitvā passanti; passitvā pāṭekkaṃ uposathaṃ karonti. Āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-kd2:34.9.6.eng: If they investigate, and they see someone, but then do the observance-day ceremony separately, there’s an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:34.9.7.pli: Te vematikā vicinanti; vicinitvā passanti; passitvā—‘nassantete, vinassantete, ko tehi attho’ti—bhedapurekkhārā uposathaṃ karonti. Āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-kd2:34.9.7.eng: If they investigate, and they see someone, but think, ‘May they get lost! May they disappear! We are better off without them,’ and then do the observance-day ceremony aiming at schism, there’s a serious offense.”

pli-tv-kd2:34.10.0.eng: 35. The doing of the observance-day ceremony with those belonging to a different Buddhist sect, etc.

pli-tv-kd2:34.10.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, āgantukā bhikkhū passanti āvāsike bhikkhū nānāsaṃvāsake.
pli-tv-kd2:34.10.1.eng: “It may happen that newly-arrived monks see resident monks who belong to a different Buddhist sect,
pli-tv-kd2:34.10.1.comm: Nānāsaṁvāsaka (and samānasaṁvāsaka) need to be carefully distinguished from nānāsaṁvāsa (and samānasaṁvāsa). Only the former means “one belonging to a different Buddhist sect”. The latter means “belonging to a different community”, as decided by sīmās.

pli-tv-kd2:34.10.2.eng: but they have the view that they belong to the same one. Then—

pli-tv-kd2:34.10.3.pli: samānasaṃvāsakadiṭṭhiṃ paṭilabhitvā na pucchanti; apucchitvā ekato uposathaṃ karonti. Anāpatti.
pli-tv-kd2:34.10.3.eng: If they don’t ask the resident monks about it, and then do the observance-day ceremony together, there’s no offense.

pli-tv-kd2:34.10.4.pli: Te pucchanti; pucchitvā nābhivitaranti; anabhivitaritvā ekato uposathaṃ karonti. Āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-kd2:34.10.4.eng: If they do ask the resident monks about it, but don’t reach a clear conclusion, and then do the observance-day ceremony together, there’s an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:34.10.5.pli: Te pucchanti; pucchitvā nābhivitaranti; anabhivitaritvā pāṭekkaṃ uposathaṃ karonti. Anāpatti.
pli-tv-kd2:34.10.5.eng: If they do ask the resident monks about it, but don’t reach a clear conclusion, and then do the observance-day ceremony separately, there’s no offense.

pli-tv-kd2:34.11.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, āgantukā bhikkhū passanti āvāsike bhikkhū samānasaṃvāsake.
pli-tv-kd2:34.11.1.eng: It may happen that newly-arrived monks see resident monks who belong to the same Buddhist sect,

pli-tv-kd2:34.11.2.eng: but they have the view that they belong to a different one. Then—

pli-tv-kd2:34.11.3.pli: nānāsaṃvāsakadiṭṭhiṃ paṭilabhitvā na pucchanti; apucchitvā ekato uposathaṃ karonti. Āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-kd2:34.11.3.eng: If they don’t ask the resident monks about it, and then do the observance-day ceremony together, there’s an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:34.11.4.pli: Te pucchanti; pucchitvā abhivitaranti; abhivitaritvā pāṭekkaṃ uposathaṃ karonti. Āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-kd2:34.11.4.eng: If they do ask the resident monks about it, and they change their view, but then do the observance-day ceremony separately, there’s an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:34.11.5.pli: Te pucchanti; pucchitvā abhivitaranti; abhivitaritvā ekato uposathaṃ karonti. Anāpatti.
pli-tv-kd2:34.11.5.eng: If they do ask the resident monks about it, and they change their view, and then do the observance-day ceremony together, there’s no offense.

pli-tv-kd2:34.12.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, āvāsikā bhikkhū passanti āgantuke bhikkhū nānāsaṃvāsake.
pli-tv-kd2:34.12.1.eng: It may happen that resident monks see newly-arrived monks who belong to a different Buddhist sect,

pli-tv-kd2:34.12.2.eng: but they have the view that they belong to the same one. Then—

pli-tv-kd2:34.12.3.pli: samānasaṃvāsakadiṭṭhiṃ paṭilabhitvā na pucchanti; apucchitvā ekato uposathaṃ karonti. Anāpatti.
pli-tv-kd2:34.12.3.eng: If they don’t ask the newly-arrived monks about it, and then do the observance-day ceremony together, there’s no offense.

pli-tv-kd2:34.12.4.pli: Te pucchanti; pucchitvā nābhivitaranti; anabhivitaritvā ekato uposathaṃ karonti. Āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-kd2:34.12.4.eng: If they do ask the newly-arrived monks about it, but don’t reach a clear conclusion, and then do the observance-day ceremony together, there’s an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:34.12.5.pli: Te pucchanti; pucchitvā nābhivitaranti; anabhivitaritvā pāṭekkaṃ uposathaṃ karonti. Anāpatti.
pli-tv-kd2:34.12.5.eng: If they do ask the newly-arrived monks about it, but don’t reach a clear conclusion, and then do the observance-day ceremony separately, there’s no offense.

pli-tv-kd2:34.13.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, āvāsikā bhikkhū passanti āgantuke bhikkhū samānasaṃvāsake.
pli-tv-kd2:34.13.1.eng: It may happen that resident monks see newly-arrived monks who belong to the same Buddhist sect,

pli-tv-kd2:34.13.2.eng: but they have the view that they belong to a different one. Then—

pli-tv-kd2:34.13.3.pli: nānāsaṃvāsakadiṭṭhiṃ paṭilabhitvā na pucchanti; apucchitvā ekato uposathaṃ karonti. Āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-kd2:34.13.3.eng: If they don’t ask the newly-arrived monks about it, and then do the observance-day ceremony together, there’s an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:34.13.4.pli: Te pucchanti; pucchitvā abhivitaranti; abhivitaritvā pāṭekkaṃ uposathaṃ karonti. Āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-kd2:34.13.4.eng: If they do ask the newly-arrived monks about it, and they change their view, but then do the observance-day ceremony separately, there’s an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:34.13.5.pli: Te pucchanti; pucchitvā abhivitaranti; abhivitaritvā ekato uposathaṃ karonti. Anāpatti.
pli-tv-kd2:34.13.5.eng: If they do ask the newly-arrived monks about it, and they change their view, and then do the observance-day ceremony together, there’s no offense.”

pli-tv-kd2:35.1.1.pli: Na, bhikkhave, tadahuposathe sabhikkhukā āvāsā abhikkhuko āvāso gantabbo, aññatra saṅghena aññatra antarāyā.
pli-tv-kd2:35.1.1.eng: “On the observance day you shouldn’t go from a monastery with monks to a monastery without monks, except if you go with a sangha or there are dangers.

pli-tv-kd2:35.1.2.pli: Na, bhikkhave, tadahuposathe sabhikkhukā āvāsā abhikkhuko anāvāso gantabbo, aññatra saṅghena aññatra antarāyā.
pli-tv-kd2:35.1.2.eng: On the observance day you shouldn’t go from a monastery with monks to a non-monastery without monks, except if you go with a sangha or there are dangers.
pli-tv-kd2:35.1.2.comm: Here and below I understand a monastery, an āvāsa, to refer to a monastery with a properly defined zone, a sīmā. A non-monastery, an anāvāsa, is then a monastic residence without such a zone.

pli-tv-kd2:35.1.3.pli: Na, bhikkhave, tadahuposathe sabhikkhukā āvāsā abhikkhuko āvāso vā anāvāso vā gantabbo, aññatra saṅghena aññatra antarāyā.
pli-tv-kd2:35.1.3.eng: On the observance day you shouldn’t go from a monastery with monks to a monastery or a non-monastery without monks, except if you go with a sangha or there are dangers.

pli-tv-kd2:35.2.1.pli: Na, bhikkhave, tadahuposathe sabhikkhukā anāvāsā abhikkhuko āvāso gantabbo, aññatra saṅghena aññatra antarāyā.
pli-tv-kd2:35.2.1.eng: On the observance day you shouldn’t go from a non-monastery with monks to a monastery without monks, except if you go with a sangha or there are dangers.

pli-tv-kd2:35.2.2.eng: On the observance day you shouldn’t go from a non-monastery with monks to a non-monastery without monks, except if you go with a sangha or there are dangers.

pli-tv-kd2:35.2.3.eng: On the observance day you shouldn’t go from a non-monastery with monks to a monastery or a non-monastery without monks, except if you go with a sangha or there are dangers.

pli-tv-kd2:35.3.1.eng: On the observance day you shouldn’t go from a monastery or a non-monastery with monks to a monastery without monks, except if you go with a sangha or there are dangers.

pli-tv-kd2:35.3.3.eng: On the observance day you shouldn’t go from a monastery or a non-monastery with monks to a monastery or a non-monastery without monks, except if you go with a sangha or there are dangers.

pli-tv-kd2:35.4.1.pli: Na, bhikkhave, tadahuposathe sabhikkhukā āvāsā sabhikkhuko āvāso gantabbo, yatthassu bhikkhū nānāsaṃvāsakā, aññatra saṅghena aññatra antarāyā.
pli-tv-kd2:35.4.1.eng: On the observance day you shouldn’t go from a monastery with monks to a monastery with monks who belong to a different Buddhist sect, except if you go with a sangha or there are dangers.

pli-tv-kd2:35.4.2.eng: On the observance day you shouldn’t go from a monastery with monks to a non-monastery with monks who belong to a different Buddhist sect, except if you go with a sangha or there are dangers.

pli-tv-kd2:35.4.3.pli: Na, bhikkhave, tadahuposathe sabhikkhukā āvāsā sabhikkhuko āvāso vā anāvāso vā gantabbo, yatthassu bhikkhū nānāsaṃvāsakā, aññatra saṅghena aññatra antarāyā.

pli-tv-kd2:35.4.4.eng: On the observance day you shouldn’t go from a non-monastery with monks to a monastery with monks who belong to a different Buddhist sect, except if you go with a sangha or there are dangers.

pli-tv-kd2:35.4.5.pli: Na, bhikkhave, tadahuposathe sabhikkhukā anāvāsā sabhikkhuko anāvāso gantabbo, yatthassu bhikkhū nānāsaṃvāsakā, aññatra saṅghena aññatra antarāyā.

pli-tv-kd2:35.4.7.pli: Na, bhikkhave, tadahuposathe sabhikkhukā āvāsā vā anāvāsā vā sabhikkhuko āvāso gantabbo, yatthassu bhikkhū nānāsaṃvāsakā, aññatra saṅghena aññatra antarāyā.

pli-tv-kd2:35.4.8.pli: Na, bhikkhave, tadahuposathe sabhikkhukā āvāsā vā anāvāsā vā sabhikkhuko anāvāso gantabbo, yatthassu bhikkhū nānāsaṃvāsakā, aññatra saṅghena aññatra antarāyā.
pli-tv-kd2:35.4.8.eng: On the observance day you shouldn’t go from a monastery or a non-monastery with monks to a non-monastery with monks who belong to a different Buddhist sect, except if you go with a sangha or there are dangers.

pli-tv-kd2:35.4.9.pli: Na, bhikkhave, tadahuposathe sabhikkhukā āvāsā vā anāvāsā vā sabhikkhuko āvāso vā anāvāso vā gantabbo, yatthassu bhikkhū nānāsaṃvāsakā, aññatra saṅghena aññatra antarāyā.
pli-tv-kd2:35.4.9.eng: On the observance day you shouldn’t go from a monastery or a non-monastery with monks to a monastery or a non-monastery with monks who belong to a different Buddhist sect, except if you go with a sangha or there are dangers.”

pli-tv-kd2:35.5.1.pli: Gantabbo, bhikkhave, tadahuposathe sabhikkhukā āvāsā sabhikkhuko āvāso, yatthassu bhikkhū samānasaṃvāsakā, yaṃ jaññā—
pli-tv-kd2:35.5.1.eng: “On the observance day you may go from a monastery with monks to a monastery with monks who belong to the same Buddhist sect if you know

pli-tv-kd2:35.5.2.eng: you’ll get there on the same day.

pli-tv-kd2:35.5.3.pli: Gantabbo, bhikkhave, tadahuposathe sabhikkhukā āvāsā sabhikkhuko anāvāso …pe…
pli-tv-kd2:35.5.3.eng: On the observance day you may go from a monastery with monks to a non-monastery with monks …

pli-tv-kd2:35.5.4.pli: sabhikkhuko āvāso vā anāvāso vā, yatthassu bhikkhū samānasaṃvāsakā, yaṃ jaññā—
pli-tv-kd2:35.5.4.eng: to a monastery or a non-monastery with monks who belong to the same Buddhist sect if you know

pli-tv-kd2:35.5.5.eng: you’ll get there on the same day.

pli-tv-kd2:35.5.6.pli: Gantabbo, bhikkhave, tadahuposathe sabhikkhukā anāvāsā sabhikkhuko āvāso …pe…
pli-tv-kd2:35.5.6.eng: On the observance day you may go from a non-monastery with monks to a monastery with monks …

pli-tv-kd2:35.5.8.pli: sabhikkhuko āvāso vā anāvāso vā, yatthassu bhikkhū samānasaṃvāsakā, yaṃ jaññā—
pli-tv-kd2:35.5.8.eng: to a monastery or a non-monastery with monks who belong to the same Buddhist sect if you know

pli-tv-kd2:35.5.9.eng: you’ll get there on the same day.

pli-tv-kd2:35.5.10.pli: Gantabbo, bhikkhave, tadahuposathe sabhikkhukā āvāsā vā anāvāsā vā sabhikkhuko āvāso …pe…
pli-tv-kd2:35.5.10.eng: On the observance day you may go from a monastery or a non-monastery with monks to a monastery with monks …

pli-tv-kd2:35.5.12.pli: sabhikkhuko āvāso vā anāvāso vā, yatthassu bhikkhū samānasaṃvāsakā, yaṃ jaññā—
pli-tv-kd2:35.5.12.eng: to a monastery or a non-monastery with monks who belong to the same Buddhist sect if you know

pli-tv-kd2:35.5.13.eng: you’ll get there on the same day.”

pli-tv-kd2:36.1.0.eng: 38. The identification of persons to be avoided

pli-tv-kd2:36.1.1.pli: Na, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyā nisinnaparisāya pātimokkhaṃ uddisitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:36.1.1.eng: “You shouldn’t recite the Monastic Code with a nun seated in the gathering.

pli-tv-kd2:36.1.2.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:36.1.3.eng: You shouldn’t recite the Monastic Code with a trainee nun,

pli-tv-kd2:36.1.6.eng: one who has renounced the training,

pli-tv-kd2:36.1.7.pli: na antimavatthuṃ ajjhāpannakassa nisinnaparisāya pātimokkhaṃ uddisitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:36.1.7.eng: or one who has committed the worst kind of offense seated in the gathering.

pli-tv-kd2:36.1.8.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:36.2.1.pli: Na āpattiyā adassane ukkhittakassa nisinnaparisāya pātimokkhaṃ uddisitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:36.2.1.eng: You shouldn’t recite the Monastic Code with one who has been ejected for not recognizing an offense seated in the gathering.

pli-tv-kd2:36.2.2.eng: If you do, you should be dealt with according to the rule.

pli-tv-kd2:36.2.3.eng: You shouldn’t recite the Monastic Code with one who has been ejected for not making amends for an offense seated in the gathering

pli-tv-kd2:36.2.4.pli: na pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge ukkhittakassa nisinnaparisāya pātimokkhaṃ uddisitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd2:36.2.4.eng: or with one who has been ejected for not giving up a bad view seated in the gathering.

pli-tv-kd2:36.2.5.eng: If you do, you should be dealt with according to the rule.

pli-tv-kd2:36.3.1.eng: You shouldn’t recite the Monastic Code with a paṇḍaka seated in the gathering.

pli-tv-kd2:36.3.2.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:36.3.3.eng: You shouldn’t recite the Monastic Code with a fake monk,

pli-tv-kd2:36.3.4.eng: with one who has previously left to join the monastics of another religion,

pli-tv-kd2:36.3.8.eng: with a murderer of a perfected one,

pli-tv-kd2:36.3.9.eng: with one who has raped a nun,

pli-tv-kd2:36.3.10.eng: with one has caused a schism in the Sangha,

pli-tv-kd2:36.3.11.eng: with one who has caused the Buddha to bleed,

pli-tv-kd2:36.3.12.eng: or with a hermaphrodite seated in the gathering.

pli-tv-kd2:36.3.13.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd2:36.4.1.pli: Na, bhikkhave, pārivāsikapārisuddhidānena uposatho kātabbo, aññatra avuṭṭhitāya parisāya.
pli-tv-kd2:36.4.1.eng: You shouldn’t do the observance-day ceremony with a passed-on purity that has expired, except if the gathering is still seated together.
pli-tv-kd2:36.4.1.comm: “A passed-on purity that has expired”, pārivāsikapārisuddhidānena, seems to refer to purity that was conveyed for a different occasion. So long as the assembly is still seated, the occasion is regarded as the same. See the discussion to Bi Pc 81 in Appendix on Individual Bhikkhunī Rules.

pli-tv-kd2:36.4.2.pli: Na ca, bhikkhave, anuposathe uposatho kātabbo, aññatra saṅghasāmaggiyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd2:36.4.2.eng: You shouldn’t do the observance-day ceremony on a non-observance day, except to unify the Sangha.”

pli-tv-kd2:36.4.3.eng: The third section for recitation is finished.

pli-tv-kd2:36.4.4.eng: The second chapter on the observance day is finished.

pli-tv-kd2:36.4.13.eng: One after another, two, and small.

pli-tv-kd2:36.4.16.eng: Should establish the monastery zone first,

pli-tv-kd2:36.4.17.eng: Should abolish the monastery zone afterwards.

pli-tv-kd2:36.4.19.eng: In a river, in the ocean, in a lake;

pli-tv-kd2:36.4.20.eng: A splash of water, they made overlap,

pli-tv-kd2:36.4.23.eng: Primitive tribes, and even when there were none;

pli-tv-kd2:36.4.24.eng: A teaching, Monastic Law, they made threats,

pli-tv-kd2:36.4.28.eng: Four or five, and others state,

pli-tv-kd2:36.4.29.eng: Also if deliberately, one should make an effort.

pli-tv-kd2:36.4.30.eng: Included lay people, without being asked,

pli-tv-kd2:36.4.31.eng: He did not know at Codanā;

pli-tv-kd2:36.4.38.eng: Straightaway, observance day in the rainy season,

pli-tv-kd2:36.4.43.eng: They did not know, one who is learned;

pli-tv-kd2:36.4.45.eng: And none of the gathering has left.

pli-tv-kd2:36.4.51.eng: The fourteenth and the fifteenth, again;

pli-tv-kd2:36.4.53.eng: Characteristics, belonging to a Buddhist sect, hermaphrodite.

pli-tv-kd2:36.4.58.eng: In this chapter there are eighty-six topics.

pli-tv-kd2:36.4.59.eng: The chapter on the observance day is finished.
